Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üöÄ Join Movify ‚Äì Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don‚Äôt just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




ü§† What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company‚Äôs data strategy and best practices




ü§ì Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




üòç Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g‚Äôs Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists ‚Äúroll up their sleeves‚Äù, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees‚Äô commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
FREELANCE DATA SCIENTIST

Start Date: ASAP (May 1, 2025)

Duration: 220 working days (~11 months)

Location: Brussels, Hybrid (50%)

Industry: Banking




Responsibilities

Improve and optimize the FDI/FOI validation tool.
Convert existing tools to R/Python for DWH Cloud migration.
Document all tools and processes effectively.
Work closely with stakeholders to align solutions with business needs.
Define and execute test plans to ensure quality and reliability.




Key Experience & Skills Required

Technical Skills

Programming: R, Python, SQL, SAS, Databricks.
BI Tools: Power BI, Power Apps.
Strong documentation and testing skills.

Languages

French and/or Dutch (spoken & written).
English (for documentation).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist / Responsible AI Consultant




Location: Brussels

Work Mode: Hybrid (50% on-site, 50% remote)

End Date: 02/01/2026

Languages: English (fluent) + French or Dutch (proficient)




Role Overview

As a Responsible AI Consultant, you will apply Python and C++ expertise to assess AI risks, improve transparency, and ensure compliance. Your focus will be on developing technical solutions for AI accountability, bias mitigation, and explainability. You will work closely with Legal, Risk, and Compliance teams‚Äîwho cover EU AI Act and GDPR requirements‚Äîto align AI models with regulatory and ethical standards.




Key Responsibilities

Develop tools in Python and C++ for AI risk assessment, bias detection, and explainability.
Implement techniques to ensure AI fairness, robustness, and transparency.
Automate compliance and governance processes through technical solutions.
Collaborate with Legal, Risk, and Compliance teams to ensure regulatory alignment.




Required Experience & Skills

Strong proficiency in Python and C++, with a focus on AI risk and governance.
Experience in developing technical solutions for AI bias, explainability, and fairness.
Ability to assess AI models from ethical, operational, and technical risk perspectives.
Financial sector experience (preferred), particularly in AI-related risk management.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Scientist

Duration: Until the end of September 2025 (With the possibility of being extended)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B




Responsibilities:




Develop and maintain machine learning models, including but not limited to, predictive models, natural language processing models, and computer vision models.
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning solutions.
Develop algorithms and statistical models to optimize machine learning models and improve their accuracy.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advances in machine learning and data science.




Expected Skills & Capabilities




Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and neural networks.
Understanding and experience with AWS SageMaker
Background working closely with Snowflake
Experience with cloud-based machine learning platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
Excellent analytical skills and profound expertise in the application of statistical modeling
Demonstrate excellent programming skills in Python & SQL as well as good skills in related analytical libraries.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üìç Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)



Make real impact with data in the world of DIY & retail
For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.

As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.



What you'll do



Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI

Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z

Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems

Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions

Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders

Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology

Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently



Who we're looking for



Technical skills



Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark

Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting

Experience building and deploying machine learning models

Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets

Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production

Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus



Business & soft skills



Able to translate data insights into strategic business advice

Strong communicator with the ability to tell clear stories with data

Comfortable managing internal and external stakeholders

Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment

Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus



Language requirements



English is required

French or Dutch is a plus



What's in it for you



A key role in the digital transformation of a leading Benelux retailer

Work with modern technologies and cloud tools

Hybrid working with flexibility and autonomy

Join an ambitious team making a real impact on millions of customers

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G‚Äôs supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;

    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client‚Äôs needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client‚Äôs needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)‚Ä¶
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java ‚Ä¶
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am currently searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to join my client in Belgium on a payroll basis.




The ideal candidate will have knowledge of Python, Machine Learning and Java (Spring Boot).




**This position is also open to fully remote candidates based in the CET time-zone**




Your Role:

Architect and Develop ML Integration: Design and implement the software architecture for machine learning integration within the product.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders (product owners, data scientists, architects, front-end engineers) to align user requirements and standards with technical specifications and integration strategies.
Back-End Oversight: Lead the design and review of back-end systems, including data access layers, ensuring seamless functionality and scalability.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on emerging tech (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Azure ML) to refine back-end architecture and enhance ML integration capabilities.







Required Skills:

Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Technical Expertise:
Strong experience in software architecture and engineering.
Skilled in Python and Java (Spring Boot).
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and OOP.
Proficient in machine learning concepts and tools.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and RESTful API design.
Work Environment: Agile/Scrum experience with a collaborative mindset.
Communication: Clear articulation of technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




The Offer:

What We Offer:

Exciting Opportunities: Be part of a dynamic, fast-growing company in the industrial analytics space, working with a global team of experts in data science, software engineering, and industrial automation.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, benefits package, and a company car or mobility budget.
Top-Tier Equipment: Developer laptop (MacBook Pro).
Flexibility: Work remotely up to 60% or fully remote if outside Belgium, with flexible working hours and a strong focus on work/life balance.
Prime Location: Access to a modern office at the Corda Campus in Hasselt.
Career Growth: Expand your skills and advance your career in a fast-expanding company with state-of-the-art tools and a visionary approach.
Supportive Environment: Collaborative, open-minded culture that encourages personal and professional development.
Learning Opportunities: Personal learning and development budget, company-managed, and external training opportunities.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Trilations is een open-minded, no-nonsense consultancy organisatie. Wij geloven sterk in langdurig engagement, met zowel onze klanten als onze medewerkers. Wij investeren in het delen van kennis, levenslang leren en coaching en bouwen voort op onze pragmatische cultuur, die is gebaseerd op vertrouwen, professionaliteit, integriteit en betrokkenheid.


De consultants van Trilations onderscheiden zich door hun expertise en hun professionele en klantgerichte, vriendelijke houding. Momenteel zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist.


Functieomschrijving

De klanten van Trilations zijn Business Insights verantwoordelijken en hun team binnen toonaangevende bedrijven in de pharma sector zowel in het binnen- als buitenland (EU, LATAM, Americas and Asia). Onze consultants werken nauw samen met het team van de klant en ondersteun het team in het vertalen van hun business-uitdaging naar concrete projecten, het opzetten en uitvoeren van het analyse plan en finaal het delen van de nieuw bekomen inzichten.


In je rol als data scientist werk je nauw samen met zowel het intern project team van Trilations als het team van de klant. Je ondersteunt onze consultants in het aanleveren van waardevolle inzichten die je haalt uit analyses van omvangrijke kwantitatieve & kwalitatieve datasets afkomstig van klanten of eigen marktonderzoek. Het resultaat van je analyses helpt de klant om in te zetten op verbeteringen die het meeste ROI opleveren.


Om deze inzichten te bekomen ga je concreet aan de slag met:

  • Statistische technieken zoals regressie, factor analyse, clustering, etc
  • Machine learning technieken zoals SVM, random forests,...
  • Large language models om inzichten te verwerven uit teksten


Je werkt mee aan de innovatie van Trilations door het ontwikkelen van nieuwe services obv data.


Profiel

  • Je hebt een masterdiploma in een kwantitatieve richting (Wiskunde, Statistics, Data Science, AI, IT, Ingenieurswetenschappen, Experimentele Psychologie,...). Een doctoraatservaring wordt ook in overweging genomen;
  • Je hebt bij voorkeur een minimum van 3 jaar ervaring in een rol als scientist of analyst;
  • Je hebt een grondige kennis van Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn,...) en SQL;
  • Ervaring met LLMs en LangChain is een grote troef;
  • Kennis van SPSS is een plus;
  • Je analytische geest en flexibiliteit zijn belangrijk voor het uitvoeren van je job. Je hebt ook ervaring met het beheren en interpreteren van datasets voor het leveren van bruikbare inzichten;
  • Je hebt een proactieve houding en bent in staat om zelfstandig projecten te beheren en effectief samen te werken met diverse teams binnen een organisatie;
  • Je bent gepassioneerd door data en werkt zeer graag in een team;
  • Je beschikt over een grote interesse in de lifesciences sector en hebt ambitie om te groeien. Ervaring en/of kennis in de pharma sector is een pluspunt.


Aanbod

  • Je krijgt een boeiende en gevarieerde functie die je de mogelijkheid biedt je expertise en vaardigheden verder uit te bouwen in een dynamisch team;
  • De mogelijkheid om voor toonaangevende bedrijven te werken, zowel nationaal als internationaal;
  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris met extralegale voordelen, 32 vakantiedagen en een firmawagen of mobiliteitsbudget;
  • Een persoonlijk groeitraject in functie van je mogelijkheden en ambities.


We zijn #ONETEAM

Bij Trilations streven we naar gelijke kansen in ons rekruteringsproces, vrij van vooroordelen of discriminatie op basis van (maar niet beperkt tot) ras, kleur, religie, geslacht, genderidentiteit, seksuele geaardheid, nationaliteit, genetica, beperking of leeftijd. We cre√´ren een bedrijfscultuur waarin iedereen zich gerespecteerd, gewaardeerd en ondersteund voelt. Zowel binnen als buiten ons bedrijf zetten we ons in voor een omgeving zonder discriminatie, waarin iedereen zichzelf kan zijn.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Brayton Global is currently looking for a Data Scientist to work for a prestigious client based in Brussels, Belgium (possibility to work on-site and/or remotely)




JOB DESCRIPTION




We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist for a 3 to 6-month mission to support our client in their Moodle-related initiatives. The role requires expertise in Moodle and its plug-ins, as well as the ability to navigate stakeholder discussions effectively.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret data related to Moodle and its database to optimize performance and resolve issues.
Collaborate with Business Analysts (BAs) and other team members to define requirements and drive solutions.
Provide insights into Moodle plug-ins and customization options based on data analysis.
Facilitate discussions among stakeholders to align expectations and define clear objectives.
Support the documentation process, ensuring clear and structured reporting of findings and recommendations.




PROFILE

Level of education : bachelor‚Äôs level or 3 years of higher education.




Key Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist, ideally in projects involving Moodle or similar LMS platforms.
Strong database management skills, particularly in Moodle-related environments.
Ability to write clear and structured documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to moderate stakeholder discussions and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Experience facilitating workshops and stakeholder alignment sessions is a plus.




Kindly note that we require European citizenships for this position because we are NOT able to provide sponsorships.

  • la connaissance des technologies suivantes est un atout : composants des sciences des donn√©es disponibles dans Azure, Databricks et MLOps
  • l'utilisation et l'explication de techniques math√©matiques (statistiques, algorithmes, apprentissage automatique, etc.) ne vous effraient pas

  • vous poss√©dez une bonne connaissance du fran√ßais, du n√©erlandais et de l'anglais (niveau B1)
  • Un salaire attractif et de nombreux avantages extra-l√©gaux (assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation, iPhone avec abonnement...) avec un bon √©quilibre vie professionnelle et vie priv√©e et la possibilit√© de travailler √† domicile

Title: Data Scientist (V/M/X)
Description:
Het Data Science Center (DSC) is een dynamisch team binnen het Data & Analytics Office (GO) dat zich inzet om de producten en diensten van NBB te verbeteren met behulp van geavanceerde data science technieken. Het DSC fungeert als een center of expertise, bestaande uit 10 collega's met diepgaande kennis in verschillende data science domeinen. Het DSC stelt zijn expertise ter beschikking van heel de NBB en werkt waar mogelijk samen met andere centrale banken, waardoor zowel de gebruikte technologie√´n als de toepassingsdomeinen zeer gevarieerd zijn en continu evolueren.

Werken in het DSC betekent continu je data science expertise up-to-date houden, en deze inzetten om bij te dragen aan de missies van NBB.


je blijft op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen binnen data science, in het bijzonder van de mogelijkheden en de beperkingen van kwantitatieve methodes (tijdsreeksanalyse, AI, machine learning, statistiek, wiskunde,‚Ä¶)
je bent bereid je voortdurend bij te scholen in deze technieken, je hebt inzicht in de technieken en legt de voor- en/of nadelen ervan uit aan je collega's
je onderzoekt en werkt mee aan concrete problemen binnen verschillenden entiteiten van de Bank, je geeft coaching aan collega's en je probeert generieke componenten voor transversaal gebruik te detecteren en te implementeren
je documenteert de oplossingen en moedigt het gebruik van de transversale componenten aan bij andere entiteiten van de Bank, bv door het geven van opleidingen in de context van de Data Academy
je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
kennis van de volgende technologie√´n zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)
Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en priv√©leven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
Een echte carri√®re: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carri√®re verder uit te bouwen
Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer
Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen‚Ä¶), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.


Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Engineer (Financial Sector) ‚Äì Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are looking for a skilled Freelance AI Engineer to work closely with our data team and drive AI-powered innovations in the financial sector. Based in Brussels, this 12-month contract involves collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI models for fraud detection, risk assessment, and automated financial decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data team (data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers) to build and deploy AI-driven financial solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models for risk management, fraud detection, algorithmic trading, and credit scoring.
Optimize AI models for real-time financial applications while ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Work with big data platforms to process large-scale structured and unstructured financial datasets.
Develop and maintain end-to-end AI pipelines, including data ingestion, model training, and deployment.
Deploy AI models using MLOps best practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, and retraining).
Ensure AI solutions comply with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for scalable AI deployment.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve financial analytics and decision-making.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or C++ for AI/ML development.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience in AI model deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for working with financial data.
Familiarity with big data processing technologies (Apache Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Experience in cloud computing (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
Solid understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow).

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset.
Ability to collaborate effectively with data scientists, analysts, and engineers.
Excellent communication skills to explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, with a focus on model accuracy and ethical AI considerations.

Preferred Experience

Prior experience in the financial sector (banking, fintech, insurance).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II) as they relate to AI.
Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT), robo-advisors, or automated financial systems is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid ‚Äì On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or directly email me at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: ‚öôÔ∏è Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you‚Äôll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.

The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.

At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.

We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.

What You'll Find At Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].

What We‚Äôre Looking For


You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You‚Äôre familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
Programming in Python and SQL is something you‚Äôre very comfortable with.
Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You‚Äôve been in contact with at least one.
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you‚Äôre aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn‚Äôt scare you.
You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,‚Ä¶)
You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.


This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us

The Offer


An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
Opportunities for individual training and team learning.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.

Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!
Show more

This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us

The Offer

  • An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
    • Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
    • Hospitalization and group insurance
    • High-end laptop
    • Smartphone with subscription
    • Substantial amount of holidays
    • Meal vouchers
    • ...
  • Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
  • Opportunities for individual training and team learning.
  • Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.
Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged ‚Äì to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production ‚Äì and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders ‚Äì clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,‚Ä¶


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,‚Ä¶
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE‚Äôs, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD‚Äôs, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,‚Ä¶) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K‚Ç¨ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!




At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (SN0626)
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to develop and optimize Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines to enhance LLM-driven troubleshooting. The ideal candidate will have experience with vector search, cloud deployment on AWS, and machine learning frameworks.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and optimize RAG pipelines for efficient knowledge retrieval in LLM applications.
Work with PyVector to store and retrieve relevant data effectively.
Implement vector embedding models to enhance retrieval accuracy.
Deploy and scale ML models on AWS for cloud-based applications.
Fine-tune and evaluate LLMs for improved task-specific reasoning and accuracy.
Collaborate with a team of global experts to drive innovation in LLM-powered solutions.


Required Skills & Qualifications


1-3 years of industry experience in machine learning and cloud-based ML deployment.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree from a top university in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, or a related field.
Python development skills
RAG architectures
retrieval techniques
PyVector for vector search and retrieval
vector embedding models
AWS cloud services for ML deployment
LangChain, LlamaIndex, or other RAG frameworks.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization‚Äôs cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.


, ING Bank
Show more

In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
  • Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines

An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours

  • Self-learning abilities
  • Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
  • Naturally curious & always a step ahead
  • Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
  • Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.

, ING Bank

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We‚Äôre seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you‚Äôll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client is seeking AI/ML Engineers with expertise in computer vision and image processing. They are a heavily funded and ambitious AI start-up based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.




The ideal candidate will develop and optimize deep learning models / VLMs for object detection, segmentation, classification, text extraction, and fine-tuning for domain-specific applications.




My client is seeking top talent globally, ideally they are looking for candidates from tier 1 or equivalent companies and top education backgrounds.




You will be integral to developing industry-leading AI software driven by cutting-edge research. You will have the opportunity to design, implement, and deploy innovative software solutions in a fast-paced environment while working alongside ex tech-giant professionals from the likes of Amazon, Meta, Google DeepMind, McKinsey and Microsoft.




Alongside your tax-free salary you will be offered a region leading benefits package including:




A months salary to cover relocation costs for you and your family.
Education allowance for up to 3 children (private schooling).
Annual flight home for you + family.
Private healthcare for you + family.
Accommodation for a month on arrival.
Annual 25% bonus.




To discover more, apply now!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer ‚Äì AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years‚Äô experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Data Scientist - 022979
Description:
Role: Data Scientist - 022979

Location: VASS BRUSSELS

–ê global digital transformation company with a team of more than 4,900 global players in 26 countries ‚Äì in Europe, America and Asia, working together to put organizations at the forefront of innovation by bringing together talent, knowledge and technology.

Our approach is based on conscious technology, through which we create positive environments and meaningful opportunities, always in our own way, making the complex simple.

VASS BeNeLux, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Expert Data Scientist - 022979 to work from the European Commission.

The role:


Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and




deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution


Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing




(NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);


Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL)
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Scripting and programming.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack




(including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc‚Ä¶)


Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as




necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

You have:

To have a bachelor of minimum 3 years

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:


Excellent knowledge of Perl, Python, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn,




pandas‚Ä¶);


Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM,




Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;


Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
Good knowledge of Linux;
Good knowledge of Unix and Bash;
Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development




methodologies;


Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience




with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU

scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality;


Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, etc.;
Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc;
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.
Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing
Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData‚Ä¶)
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio‚Ä¶)
Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies.
Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive




(simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism

detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems


Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously.
Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering.
Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies




SPECIFIC EXPERTISE


Experienced in NLP ‚Äì Machine Learning
Experienced in Python language




If you want to join a dynamic company where technological challenges will be found in your day to day we are waiting for you in the great VASS team.

And we encourage you to be the best version of yourself: Transformative, Creative, Honest, Vibrant!

At VASS we take action every day to achieve a favourable environment that facilitates and promotes equal opportunities, non-discrimination, diversity and inclusion of all people. We select our talent based on business needs, skills and merits. üåü

Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Plain is redefining customer support for the next generation of B2B companies. We‚Äôre building the fastest, most powerful platform to help companies move beyond reactive support and build true customer relationships.

B2B customer support is undergoing a seismic shift. AI is transforming the way companies engage with customers, shifting support from a siloed function to a company-wide effort across Slack, Discord, and in-product experiences. The old way ‚Äì slow, manual, and disconnected ‚Äì no longer works.

Some of the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking companies ‚Äì like Stytch, Sanity, and Fly.io ‚Äì trust Plain to unify all customer interactions, enable faster team collaboration, and supercharge their workflows with AI.

What you‚Äôll do

We‚Äôre in a rare position. We‚Äôve already built a deeply scalable, lightning-fast support platform that high-growth companies love. AI has been at the core of our product for a while now ‚Äì but now, we want to take it to the next level. We have the opportunity to define how AI powers customer support at every level, from automating workflows to deeply understanding customer needs.

This is where you come in.

We‚Äôre looking for a sharp, fast-moving, and customer-obsessed Founding AI Engineer to accelerate our AI ambitions. This is a rare chance to shape the AI strategy of an early-stage, high-impact product and help build a category-defining company.

Engineering at Plain isn‚Äôt about just moving tickets. It‚Äôs about solving complex, high-impact problems ‚Äì owning them end-to-end, from prototype to production.

In this role, you will:


Define our AI infrastructure and play a key role in shaping our AI strategy.
Own and ship AI-powered features from concept to production.
Solve complex machine learning challenges ‚Äì especially around AI accuracy, reliability, and quality ‚Äì using a rigorous, truth-seeking approach.
Serve as the team‚Äôs AI expert, helping to build a world-class AI practice.
Advocate for our work externally ‚Äì writing, speaking, and engaging with the broader AI community.


This is a great fit if you‚Ä¶


Are an experienced backend engineer who‚Äôs built AI products in the OpenAI & Anthropic era ‚Äì especially text- and data-heavy AI applications.
Have AI observability experience. AI isn‚Äôt just about shipping features that sound great ‚Äì it‚Äôs about knowing, conclusively, if they‚Äôre making things better.
Have a clear perspective on what makes a great AI-powered product. We want to apply AI with precision, nuance, and real impact ‚Äì not as a gimmick.
Are self-driven, impact-focused, and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment.
Measure your success by user impact, not just technical elegance.
Bonus: You have a data science background that helps you fine-tune AI accuracy and quality.


This won‚Äôt be the right role if you‚Ä¶


Have only academic or research ML/AI experience. We need someone who‚Äôs applied AI to real products, not just explored theoretical models.
Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex ‚Äì we‚Äôre AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
Struggle with ambiguity. We‚Äôre an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive ‚Äì not what‚Äôs trendy. (Postgres is great.)
Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we‚Äôre a startup ‚Äì this is a different kind of opportunity.


Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: ¬£75K - ¬£130K


Show more

  • Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex ‚Äì we‚Äôre AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
  • Struggle with ambiguity. We‚Äôre an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
  • Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive ‚Äì not what‚Äôs trendy. (Postgres is great.)
  • Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
  • Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we‚Äôre a startup ‚Äì this is a different kind of opportunity.

Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: ¬£75K - ¬£130K
