Title: Data Scientist (V/M/X)
Description:
Het Data Science Center (DSC) is een dynamisch team binnen het Data & Analytics Office (GO) dat zich inzet om de producten en diensten van NBB te verbeteren met behulp van geavanceerde data science technieken. Het DSC fungeert als een center of expertise, bestaande uit 10 collega's met diepgaande kennis in verschillende data science domeinen. Het DSC stelt zijn expertise ter beschikking van heel de NBB en werkt waar mogelijk samen met andere centrale banken, waardoor zowel de gebruikte technologie√´n als de toepassingsdomeinen zeer gevarieerd zijn en continu evolueren.

Werken in het DSC betekent continu je data science expertise up-to-date houden, en deze inzetten om bij te dragen aan de missies van NBB.


je blijft op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen binnen data science, in het bijzonder van de mogelijkheden en de beperkingen van kwantitatieve methodes (tijdsreeksanalyse, AI, machine learning, statistiek, wiskunde,‚Ä¶)
je bent bereid je voortdurend bij te scholen in deze technieken, je hebt inzicht in de technieken en legt de voor- en/of nadelen ervan uit aan je collega's
je onderzoekt en werkt mee aan concrete problemen binnen verschillenden entiteiten van de Bank, je geeft coaching aan collega's en je probeert generieke componenten voor transversaal gebruik te detecteren en te implementeren
je documenteert de oplossingen en moedigt het gebruik van de transversale componenten aan bij andere entiteiten van de Bank, bv door het geven van opleidingen in de context van de Data Academy
je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
kennis van de volgende technologie√´n zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)
Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en priv√©leven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
Een echte carri√®re: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carri√®re verder uit te bouwen
Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer
Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen‚Ä¶), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.


Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: AI Engineer (SN0647)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking an AI Engineer with expertise in deep learning, NLP, reinforcement learning, and MLOps to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI solutions.


The ideal candidate will work on predictive analytics, autonomous systems, generative AI, and real-time processing while ensuring fairness, transparency, and scalability in AI models.


Key Responsibilities


Advanced AI Modeling: Develop and implement deep learning, reinforcement learning, and graph neural networks for predictive analytics, automated trading, and decision-making systems.
NLP Applications: Build state-of-the-art NLP solutions for sentiment analysis, document processing, and customer interaction using spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, and OpenAI APIs.
Vector Search & Semantic Retrieval: Design real-time, context-aware data retrieval systems using vector databases like Weaviate, Pinecone, and Milvus.
Agentic Systems: Develop autonomous multi-agent systems for dynamic decision-making in complex environments, such as trading and finance.
MLOps Integration: Deploy and scale AI models using MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Serving, and Seldon for production-ready workflows.
Big Data Engineering: Architect high-performance data pipelines using Apache Spark, Kafka, and Hadoop for real-time and batch processing.
Generative AI: Implement GPT, DALL-E, GANs, and other generative models for innovative AI applications in content generation and user experience.
Transformers & Architectures: Utilize advanced transformer models such as BERT, T5, and ViT for NLP and computer vision tasks.
AI Explainability & Fairness: Ensure transparency and bias mitigation in AI models using SHAP, LIME, and Fairlearn.
Optimization & Hyperparameter Tuning: Enhance model performance with tools like Optuna and Ray Tune.
Cloud & Edge AI: Deploy scalable AI solutions on AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure, optimizing for edge computing with TensorFlow Lite and NVIDIA Jetson.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Programming Expertise
Deep Learning Frameworks
Data Tools
Vector Databases
Reinforcement Learning
Generative AI Models
MLOps & Automation
Real-Time Processing


Soft Skills


Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
Effective team collaboration across cross-functional teams.

VASS BeNeLux, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Expert Data Scientist - 022979 to work from the European Commission.

The role:


Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and




deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution


Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing




(NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);


Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL)
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Scripting and programming.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack




(including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc‚Ä¶)


Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as




necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

You have:

To have a bachelor of minimum 3 years

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:


Excellent knowledge of Perl, Python, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn,




pandas‚Ä¶);


Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM,




Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;


Excellent knowledge of Data Management;
Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure;
Good knowledge of Linux;
Good knowledge of Unix and Bash;
Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development




methodologies;


Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience




with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU

scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality;


Knowledge of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, etc.;
Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc;
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.
Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing
Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData‚Ä¶)
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio‚Ä¶)
Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies.
Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive




(simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism

detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems


Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously.
Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering.
Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies




SPECIFIC EXPERTISE


Experienced in NLP ‚Äì Machine Learning
Experienced in Python language




If you want to join a dynamic company where technological challenges will be found in your day to day we are waiting for you in the great VASS team.

And we encourage you to be the best version of yourself: Transformative, Creative, Honest, Vibrant!

At VASS we take action every day to achieve a favourable environment that facilitates and promotes equal opportunities, non-discrimination, diversity and inclusion of all people. We select our talent based on business needs, skills and merits. üåü

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.




You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.




AND IN DETAIL

You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity ‚Ä¶) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry ‚Ä¶).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests ‚Ä¶).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.




YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

- Basic knowledge of Linux platform

- Containerization/virtualization

- AI platforms & IDEs

- CI/CD

- Code, model & data versioning

- Python

- Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management

- PostgreSQL

It is preferable you have experience with:

- Integration using different technologies and infra components

- Model compression techniques

- ELT/ETL tools

- Big data tools (Spark)

- Data flow processing

- Data visualization tools

You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other‚Äôs opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company‚Äôs success.




WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.




YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.




OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.




OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.




TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.




Good luck!




Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

  • You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
  • You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
  • You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.


YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

  • A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
  • You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

- Basic knowledge of Linux platform

- Containerization/virtualization

- AI platforms & IDEs

- CI/CD

- Code, model & data versioning

- Python

- Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management

- PostgreSQL

  • It is preferable you have experience with:

- Integration using different technologies and infra components

- Model compression techniques

- ELT/ETL tools

- Big data tools (Spark)

- Data flow processing

- Data visualization tools

  • You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
  • You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other‚Äôs opinions, ideas and feedback.
  • You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
  • You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
  • You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company‚Äôs success.


WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.


YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.


OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.


OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.


TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.


Good luck!


Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: Solver - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation, providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services tailored to empower its partners and address their unique challenges. We tackle complex challenges with a holistic approach, fostering collaboration across diverse expertise areas, including Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Governance.




Our "Solvers" are passionate professionals empowered by cutting-edge tools, a culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous learning opportunities. We are seeking a Generative AI Specialist to join our team of experts, helping our clients leverage the power of advanced AI technologies to transform their operations.




Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications (Mandatory)

Educational Background: Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience including at least 2 in the aforementioned specialty
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills

Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.




What You‚Äôll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.




Technical Implementation

Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.




Project Management

Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Title: Senior machine learning engineer
Description:
Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow‚Äîpeople with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Summary

A Senior Machine Learning Engineer for the DSML - COE he would be responsible for designing, developing, maintaining and integrating complex application systems and developing pipelines to answer requirements and demands of the customer. He would provide technical expertise and ensure quality and functionality of application components by overseeing the entire development lifecycle from analysis and design to implementation and support while acting as a mentor to junior developers

Responsibilities


Transforms and develops data science prototypes into ML systems using appropriate datasets and data representation models with moderate complexity.
Researches and implements appropriate ML algorithms and tools that create new systems and processes powered with ML and AI tools and techniques according to business requirements
Designs and implements workflows and analysis tools to streamline the development of new ML models at scale both in batch and streaming mode.
Creates and evolves ML models and software that enable state-of-the-art intelligent systems using best practices in all aspects of engineering and modeling lifecycles.
Extends existing ML libraries and frameworks with the developments in the Data Science and ML field for enterprise use.
Establishes, configures, and supports scalable cloud components that serve prediction model transactions
Integrates data from authoritative internal and external sources to form the foundation of a new Data Product that would deliver insights that supports business outcomes that is necessary for ML systems.
Collaborates with skilled Designers, Architects, Software Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Engineers to deliver ML products and systems for the organization.



Qualifications


3-5+ years of experience in application development, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects
Proficiency in programming languages (Python, Java, C++) and knowledgeable with frameworks like PyTorchm Perl and Tensorflow or related
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP - Preferred) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes
Knowledgeable in machine learning engineering or related tasks, with a track record of developing and deploying models in production environments.
Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail, effective communication, and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical teams.
Understanding of different SDLC methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall)
Ability to design and implement scalable and robust application architectures



Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail, effective communication, and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical teams.


Effective communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to gather requirements and convey technical concepts
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field



Employee Type:

Permanent

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Title: AI Engineer - Energy and Utilities
Description:
Position Description

As an AI engineer, you will join our international emerging technology practice. You will be working in an agile team at one of our customers where you will take the responsibility of further implementation and expansion of their generative AI platform. You will set-up data connections with other data sources like Salesforce and ServiceNow. If you are passionate about information technology and are excited about continuous learning opportunities we want to hear from you.

Your role in our team


Your will create AI orchestrator/pipelines using Microsoft nuget packages
You will deploy AI models with monitoring capabilities to ensure reliability and accuracy using MLOps principles.
Finetuning of GPT3.5 and GPT4.0 models: focus of AI model on specific domains of expertise.
You will handle the Integration of the AI solution within the existing application landscape.
You will work as part of a team in close collaboration with architects and data engineers to Build complete end-to-end AI solutions.


How You Strengthen Our Team


You have at least 3 years of experience in Python and/or .NET development
You have already a first professional experience
Familiar with AI solutions on the Azure ecosystem (cognitive search, OpenAI)
Previous experience with embedding datasets in Cognitive Services for Semantic search.
Experience in working with Vector databases
Knowledge of the Langchain framework
You have mathematical mindset and like solving complex problems.
Native NL or FR and a very good lEN level
Education and Certification
Bachelor or master degree in computer science, or equivalent


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organisations, energy , utilities, manufacturing and lifesciences companies are CGI's clients. We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen, Director Energy sector , via bart.jansen@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Experienced Data scientist - Region Brussels
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

The Tribe Artificial Intelligence aims to deliver an efficient and seamless banking experience for our customers and empower our employees through AI. Our expert team of approximately 90 experts includes Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Managers. We are seeking a Data Scientist with a minimum of 3 years of experience in developing AI applications, including both generative and predictive AI.

AND IN DETAIL


You develop AI applications to address various business challenges, including virtual assistants to enhance client experiences, advanced AI tools to support employee efficiency and creativity, and automation to optimize internal processes.
You use various analytical methods, including large language models (Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning), speech-to-text, agentic AI applications, image generation and interpretation, and classical statistical/machine learning techniques. While expertise in all areas is not required, strong proficiency in core technologies and the ability to learn new methods as needed are essential.
You contribute to deploying AI applications in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
You access one of the richest volumes of varied data in the market and apply your skills to it.
You evolve in an environment where innovation and lean processes are praised, straight-forward communication is encouraged, and peers understand the meaning of team up.
You work with a team of colleagues in an Agile organization who are ready to collaborate and to share their experience.


YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES


You hold at least a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field like statistics, computer science or engineering, with a focus on natural language processing. A PhD is advantageous. Candidates from other academic backgrounds with strong analytics knowledge are also welcome.
You have a minimum of 3 years' experience in data science, preferably in the financial sector, though less experience may be accepted if your academic achievements are substantial.
You are fluent in English and have a good command of French and/or Dutch.
You are proficient in Python for model building and understand ML engineering fundamentals (e.g., versioning systems) to produce code ready for CI/CD integration.


What We Have To Offer

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact that the financial sector can have on the world. BNP‚ÄØParibas‚ÄØFortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we are working towards a better future every day.

YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and goals.

OUR OFFER

In addition to your remuneration and benefits (meal vouchers, insurance, holidays), we offer flexible salary options, allowing you to convert part of your salary into personalised benefits (phone use, IT equipment, transport, etc.).

OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.‚ÄØ

TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you. Good luck!

Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: STEP Software Developer
Description:
We are looking for a STEP Software Developer to join our client in the Zurich area.




In this role, you'll be responsible for understanding business needs, designing and deploying solutions in Stibo Systems STEP, and ensuring smooth integration with other systems. You'll also work on optimizing data management processes, collaborate with various teams for effective implementation, maintain high data quality, and provide technical guidance and support to users with clear documentation.




If you bring over 5 years of experience in PIM/MDM systems, particularly Stibo Systems STEP, along with strong skills in JavaScript, Java, HTML, and CSS, system integration, data modeling, application customization, and scripting, plus familiarity with RESTful APIs, JSON, XML, and XSLT, a background in agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban, and fluency in both German and English, we want to hear from you!




If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the travelers' journey for millions of h olidaymakers. If you are a motivated machine learning scientist who loves to work with challenging real-world problems on big data, keep reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.





Job Description



Job Title - Machine Learning Scientist
Working model - hybrid at Chiasso office
Team - You will join the Strategic Analytics team in the Technology department.
Level - Professional
Location - Chiasso, Switzerland
Contract - Permanent - full-time (36 h/week)



What your impact will be:



Develop real-time machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems on big data
Develop Ranking Algorithms based on deep learning
Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and project managers


Qualifications



Your expertise:



A Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, or a Master's degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in machine learning.
Excellent knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) and Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction)
Good knowledge of Python and SQL, with knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis (scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, Numpy, Scipy, MLflow)
Experience with Deep Learning (Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Autoencoders)
Experience with Keras (and TensorFlow) or PyTorch

Desirable:



Experience in Uncertainty Estimation (Monte Carlo Dropout, Deep Ensembles)
Able to find creative solutions to interesting problems
Curious with a constant desire to learn and collaborate


Additional Information



Perks of working with us:



How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week, with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations



How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O'Reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content



Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.



Wish you were here? We do, too!







Selection process steps*:



- HR interview (30 minutes)
- 1st interview (Manager 1 hour): Machine learning + Python coding
- 2nd interview (Director 45 min): Soft skills + machine learning knowledge
- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)







Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.







Please submit your resume in English
Please submit your resume in English

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A leading financial services company in Zurich is looking for a Data Scientist to join their Risk Analytics team. The role involves developing and implementing ML models for credit risk and fraud prevention, working closely with specialists to deliver impactful insights, and contributing to the expansion of in-house analytics tools.




What‚Äôs in it for you?

‚úÖ Work in a dynamic, collaborative environment

‚úÖ Competitive salary + benefits

‚úÖ Hybrid setup (3 days office / 2 days home)

‚úÖ Exciting projects in a high-impact industry







Requirements:

Completed university degree with a quantitative focus
Very good analytical and conceptual skills
Very good knowledge of Python and experience with Python frameworks such as Numpy, Pandas and ML frameworks such as Scikit-learn, PyTorch
Very good knowledge of database systems and SQL
Very good knowledge of German and English
Practical experience in payment systems, credit risk and fraud prevention is an advantage
Practical experience in software development as well as with Git and CI/CD processes is an advantage
Strong Python skills (Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch)
Experience with SQL & database systems
Fluent in German & English
At least 1 year of professional experience (credit risk/fraud prevention is a plus)




If you're interested in this position, feel free to reply with your most up to date CV and we'll be in touch to discuss further!

Title: Data Scientist in GenAI, 80-100%
Description:
At Unique, we leverage generative AI to transform the financial services industry. Our mission is to revolutionize the financial sector by enhancing efficiency and driving growth. Our LLM-agnostic platform offers ready-to-use financial agents for wealth management, investment banking, and private equity. Unique is a market leader in providing generative AI solutions for financial institutions serving over 40 clients globally.




We are looking for a Data Scientist in GenAI who is passionate about exploring the latest trends in AI, researching new technologies, and enabling the development of AI-driven solutions. You will be part of the core team responsible for providing tooling and insights to the pruduct teams.

Responsibilities




Researching and evaluating the latest trends in GenAI, including state-of-the-art models and tools such as Perplexity, ChatGPT, and other emerging AI innovations
Conducting experiments on new AI tooling and methodologies to assess their feasibility and potential impact
Reverse engineering, reconstructing, and analyzing current AI trends to understand their underlying mechanics
Delegating the implementation of validated tools and solutions to Python engineers for production deployment




What do you need to succeed




PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field with touchpoints in GenAI from a leading technical university such as e.g. ETH Zurich
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs and advanced prompt engineering
Strong research capabilities with the ability to analyze, evaluate, and experiment with new AI technologies
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with engineers and product teams




What we offer / Benefits




Innovative Work Environment üöÄ Engage in groundbreaking projects within the Generative AI space
Culture üåø A modern company with flat hierarchies that focuses on a people-oriented culture and places great emphasis on transparency and open communication
Flexibilityüë©üèª‚Äçüíª in working hours and location
Competitive compensation and investment opportunities üí∞
A dog-friendly office in central Zurich üê∂

Title: Biomedical data scientist
Description:
Description

Health monitoring is a fast growing market. The trend is to gather and analyze the vitals to motivate people improving their health and to detect early medical risks. The challenge is to integrate an increasing number of sensors that measure vitals more accurately and to have a system that performs continuous tracking.

Senbiosys has developed a new generation of sensors with a high quality of signal and a significant reduction in power consumption, recently achieving a new world record. Our technology allows continuous vitals measurement such as heart rate and blood oxygen saturation with a higher precision. Our goal is to go beyond the state of the art of the vitals detection and to become a leader that improves the future of health monitoring.

We are looking for a talented Biomedical Signal Data Scientist, who will explore and develop the different signal processing schemes for our technology. We need someone that can implement new solutions to open new trends for data science and leverage the link between our unique technology and a better detection of health parameters.

Your mission

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop a medical database on a large enough population to correlate the PPG signal out of our sensor with medical parameters such us heart rate variability, oxygen saturation and blood pressure

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Interface with leading academic partners or specialized medical institutions for joint projects

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Actively contribute to define the right medical devices to measure the reference health parameters and benchmark our sensor through solid statistical approaches and protocols

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop and optimize algorithms to correlate the PPG signal with the reference health parameters

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Develop AI schemes to refine and enhance the correlation between the PPG signal properties and the reference health parameters

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Interface with the embedded software engineering team

¬†

¬†

What you can expect

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†An adventure with great talents that want to change the future of health monitoring

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†An environment in which you can grow and share new ideas

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†A flexible working model

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†As a member of a very motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Mentoring and targeted developments in new topics

Your profile

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†MSc Or PhD in biomedical engineer, computer science, electrical engineering or related fields.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven understanding of biomedical signal processing (in the time domain, eventually for PPG signals is a plus).

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven proficiency on Python

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Understanding of artificial intelligence schemes

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good programming skills, C programming would be a plus

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good English proficiency

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good communication skills

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†European citizenship or work permit in Switzerland

Additional preferred qualification

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Familiar with processing of other biomedical signals like ECG, ICG or BCG

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with projects held with medical partners

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Open-minded

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†creative, problem-solving skills

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good sense of humor

HTML:
Description

Health monitoring is a fast growing market. The trend is to gather and analyze the vitals to motivate people improving their health and to detect early medical risks. The challenge is to integrate an increasing number of sensors that measure vitals more accurately and to have a system that performs continuous tracking.

Senbiosys has developed a new generation of sensors with a high quality of signal and a significant reduction in power consumption, recently achieving a new world record. Our technology allows continuous vitals measurement such as heart rate and blood oxygen saturation with a higher precision. Our goal is to go beyond the state of the art of the vitals detection and to become a leader that improves the future of health monitoring.

We are looking for a talented Biomedical Signal Data Scientist, who will explore and develop the different signal processing schemes for our technology. We need someone that can implement new solutions to open new trends for data science and leverage the link between our unique technology and a better detection of health parameters.

Your mission

¬∑        Develop a medical database on a large enough population to correlate the PPG signal out of our sensor with medical parameters such us heart rate variability, oxygen saturation and blood pressure

¬∑        Interface with leading academic partners or specialized medical institutions for joint projects

¬∑        Actively contribute to define the right medical devices to measure the reference health parameters and benchmark our sensor through solid statistical approaches and protocols

¬∑        Develop and optimize algorithms to correlate the PPG signal with the reference health parameters

¬∑        Develop AI schemes to refine and enhance the correlation between the PPG signal properties and the reference health parameters

¬∑        Interface with the embedded software engineering team

 

 

What you can expect

¬∑        An adventure with great talents that want to change the future of health monitoring

¬∑        An environment in which you can grow and share new ideas

¬∑        A flexible working model

¬∑        As a member of a very motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day

¬∑        Mentoring and targeted developments in new topics

Your profile

¬∑        MSc Or PhD in biomedical engineer, computer science, electrical engineering or related fields.

¬∑        Proven understanding of biomedical signal processing (in the time domain, eventually for PPG signals is a plus).

¬∑        Proven proficiency on Python

¬∑        Understanding of artificial intelligence schemes

¬∑        Good programming skills, C programming would be a plus

¬∑        Good English proficiency

¬∑        Good communication skills

¬∑        European citizenship or work permit in Switzerland

Additional preferred qualification

¬∑        Familiar with processing of other biomedical signals like ECG, ICG or BCG

¬∑        Experience with projects held with medical partners

¬∑        Open-minded

¬∑        creative, problem-solving skills

¬∑        Good sense of humor

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
A Swiss life science start up is currently in its early development stages in Zurich. The company's research focuses on creating innovative, patient-specific, and clinically relevant drug sensitivity testing technologies. The main goal of these technologies is to improve disease management and help healthcare professionals optimize patient treatment outcomes. Additionally, the company aims to collaborate with pharmaceutical research partners.

A crucial aspect of the technology involves developing clinical assays and processes for automated, patient-specific drug testing in partnership with the clinical collaborators. To bolster the research team, we are looking for a highly motivated, adaptable individual with an entrepreneurial mindset.




Research scientist (80-100 %)




The ideal candidate

S. or M.Sc. with a sound background in cell biology and cell culture technology
2 years professional experience in industry or academic institutions
Experiences in managing scientific projects and/or collaborations
Cell culture expertise
Hands-on experience in 3D tumor models is highly preferred
Experience with lab automation is an advantage
Team player and multitasker

Your responsibilities

Plan, coordinate, and carry out internal and external R&D projects
Develop and manage a detailed project and work plan
Coach and supervise laboratory work and compliance with standards
Support product development
Manage contracts with vendors and suppliers by assigning tasks and communicating expected deliverables
Prepare reports and present experimental results at group and project meetings
Good command of English in communication and writing
Travel to other business locations within the EU
Hands-on laboratory work with cytostatic chemicals will be required
Occasional weekend work may be required

Title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
SamanTree Medical is an innovative Belgian-Swiss medical device revenue-stage growing startup dedicated to improving patient care and operating room efficiency through breakthrough imaging technology. The company develops and manufactures the Histolog Scanner, an advanced imaging solution that enables real-time analysis of fresh tissue samples. This visualization modality supports a wide range of surgical and diagnostic applications. SamanTree Medical is actively commercializing the Histolog Scanner across Europe, the United States and worldwide.




SamanTree is built on the passion and dedication of talented people from diverse backgrounds. We believe that breakthrough ideas can come from anywhere, so we foster a culture rooted in diversity, respect, and open-mindedness. Leading with inclusion, we empower our team members to bring their best, most authentic selves to work each day.




Our culture thrives on purpose-driven individuals who aspire to make a meaningful impact. Team members here are grounded in integrity, eager to learn, fuelled by energy, and bring a wealth of diverse, real-world perspectives that drive innovative thinking. We‚Äôre committed to our people‚Äôs long-term growth, actively investing in their potential to advance our mission and inspire them to achieve their highest potential.




Join a team setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let‚Äôs transform the future of Intra-Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.




For more information, please visit https://www.samantree.com/




To ensure the growth of SamanTree Medical, we are looking for:




Software Quality Assurance Engineer (Lausanne, Switzerland)




Roles and Responsibilities

The Software Quality Assurance (Test) Engineer is responsible for design, implementation, execution and maintenance of processes of the technical quality assurance of SamanTree Medical software products or product components and plays an important role in the products development.

Responsibilities:

Assures efficient testing and continuous integration within SamanTree Medical software code base throughout different software projects of the company. Maintains existing automated tests and extends them for the new test cases.
Works in close collaboration with the software development team to ensure consistency of the company‚Äôs software with established requirements and to provide feedback to developers and engineers.
Develops test procedures (both manual and automated) and ensures proper execution of both routine tests for running development tasks and release tests for software products and components.
Specifies software use cases and test protocols, executes tests, maintains test reports and technical product documentation in compliance with ISO 13485, IEC 62304 and applicable regulatory requirements.
Performs issue reporting in the company‚Äôs defect management system (Atlassian Jira). Ensures testing to support efficient management and resolution of software defects.




Skills, Experience and Qualifications

Education

B.Sc./Master in Science, Engineering, Engineering management, or related discipline

Experience

2+ years in relevant positions, ideally in the medical device industry

Technical Skills

Knowledge of the software development processes, experience with agile practices.
Experience with development and maintenance of automated tests for continuous integration.
Mastery of both Windows and Apple Mac operating systems. Experience with Linux (and other UNIX) is a plus.
Programming languages: proficiency with Java and Java frameworks, understanding of C, C++.
Experience with User Interface testing (manual and automated). Experience with JavaFX, CSS, Scene Builder.
Good comprehension of performance testing and of the monitoring tools.
Solid experience with:
relevant frameworks and automation tools (TestFX, Cypress, JUnit, etc)
revision maintenance system (Git)
issue management system (Atlassian Jira)
integrated development environment (IntelliJ Idea, Eclipse, etc.)
build management and continuous integration (JFrog Artifactory, JetBrains TeamCity, GitLab CI, Jenkins)
software specifications, modeling and test management tool (Sparx Enterprise Architect , TestRail)
performance profiling
Containerization and orchestration tools (such as Docker, Kubernetes) are a plus.




Languages

English (spoken and written).
French (spoken).
Russian (spoken) is a plus.




Soft Skills & personality

Autonomous and proactive, with a strong sense of initiative.
Self-organization, motivation, and commitment to continuously improving the company‚Äôs products and services
Motivation and ability to contribute to a collaborative, results-driven environment.
Experience in a start-up or other small organizations is a plus.
Handles detailed, complex concepts and problems, and balances multiple tasks simultaneously.
Establishes professional relationships with Management, employees, suppliers, and customers.
Plans and meets deadlines. Maintains a flexible work schedule.




Our offer

A full time job
Attractive and competitive salary package in line with your profile and experience
A dynamic and collaborative work environment
Opportunities for professional growth and development
A role that directly contributes to the improvement of global healthcare outcomes




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are all proud to work for such a great company as Samantree Medical. And we would be even prouder to have you on board. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, regardless of your race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Please apply if you see a position that makes your heartbeat, and if you feel the role is appealing to you. If you‚Äôre smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

SamanTree is an emerging company with significant potential in the MedTech sector. For individuals seeking challenges, SamanTree offers opportunities for growth both nationally and internationally. We value inquisitive and highly committed individuals who are dedicated to collaborating towards making SamanTree a success.




Join a team that‚Äôs setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let‚Äôs transform the future of Intra Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us:

Duferco is a global company with diverse interests spanning energy retail and trading, steel manufacturing, insurance, and logistics. Innovation has always driven our success and continues to shape our future. Our Corporate Innovation Team operates in a start-up-like, corporate-backed environment, focused on exploring, nurturing, and implementing cutting-edge ideas, technologies, and strategies to propel our organization to new heights.

At Duferco, we value talent, proactivity, and passion. We foster a culture where every team member is empowered to take ownership of their work, actively contribute to the team‚Äôs success, and grow professionally by taking on increasing responsibility. Collaboration, continuous learning, and a shared drive for innovation are central to our ethos. If you are self-motivated, eager to make an impact, and passionate about tackling challenges head-on, you‚Äôll thrive here.

As we continue to expand and diversify our operations, we are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be instrumental in advancing our mission to use advanced analytics and machine learning to drive innovation and excellence across our diverse portfolio of businesses. If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of applied data science, acting swiftly, and exploring new technologies that can make a significant impact on our business, we would love to hear from you.




Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and optimize data science solutions for various applications, including industrial manufacturing, energy retail, insurance, and trading.
Collaborate closely with business units to understand needs and gather feedback to inform and enhance data science solutions.
Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to train, validate, and deploy machine learning and AI models.
Ensure the robustness, scalability, and efficiency of models deployed in production environments.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes, or help define new ones.
Proactively research and evaluate emerging technologies to drive operational improvements.




Qualifications:

A Master's degree with 2-3 years of relevant experience, or a Ph.D., in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Python and commonly used data science and machine learning frameworks.
Experience working with both structured and unstructured data, including data pipelines, ETL processes, and organizing data in databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Familiarity with computer vision and/or natural language processing techniques (nice-to-have).
Knowledge of mathematical programming and optimization techniques (nice-to-have).
Proven experience in designing and delivering end-to-end data-driven solutions.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
The‚ÄØMicrosoft Spatial AI Lab in Zurich, Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of spatial computing. We are looking for computer vision and machine learning scientists who share our passion for developing innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users. We are based near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas.‚ÄØ

You will conduct research at the intersection of computer vision, machine learning/AI, robotics and cloud computing. This research will help humans and robotic agents to understand the environment, recognize objects, and perform tasks.‚ÄØ

This opportunity will allow you to grow your expertise in Spatial AI, learn more about deployment of algorithms to Copilot+ PCs with neural processing unit (NPU) or to cloud environments and supervise interns or be involved in joint research projects with ETH.‚ÄØ

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.‚ÄØ

Responsibilities


Works within a team to achieve goals and objectives across services, including understanding user requirements, design, and coding.‚ÄØ
Brings the State of the Art to Products - collaborates in an interdisciplinary team to bridge the gap between research and development.‚ÄØ
Grows expertise in one or more subareas of research.‚ÄØ
Develops a deep understanding of tools, technologies and methods that can be utilized to deploy product-grade, robust and efficient code in the cloud.‚ÄØ
Grows our relationships with the research community. May contribute to publications, workshops, or the supervision of interns & PhD/MS students.‚ÄØ


Qualifications

Required Qualification(s):‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


PhD in Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning or Robotics or similar professional experience.‚ÄØ
Demonstrated coding, debugging, and engineering skills in programming languages such as C++ or Python.‚ÄØ
Hands-on experience with deep learning and/or computer vision methods.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Self-motivated team-player, problem solver, and keen to learn.‚ÄØ
Ability to present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.‚ÄØ


‚ÄØ

Preferred Qualifications:‚ÄØ


Prior research in one or more of the following areas:‚ÄØ
3D scene reasoning with open vocabularies, Vision-Language Models (VLMs).‚ÄØ
Experience with deep learning models like transformers and attention mechanisms for sequence modeling.‚ÄØ
Video understanding, action and activity recognition.‚ÄØ
Experience with spatio-temporal feature extraction techniques.‚ÄØ
Object detection and semantic segmentation.‚ÄØ
Robot-environment / robot-human interaction, particularly through natural language.
Publication record at top-tier conferences and journals (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV,‚ÄØ NeurIPS, ICLR, CoRL).‚ÄØ


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

HTML:
The‚ÄØMicrosoft Spatial AI Lab in Zurich, Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of spatial computing. We are looking for computer vision and machine learning scientists who share our passion for developing innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users. We are based near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas.‚ÄØ

You will conduct research at the intersection of computer vision, machine learning/AI, robotics and cloud computing. This research will help humans and robotic agents to understand the environment, recognize objects, and perform tasks.‚ÄØ

This opportunity will allow you to grow your expertise in Spatial AI, learn more about deployment of algorithms to Copilot+ PCs with neural processing unit (NPU) or to cloud environments and supervise interns or be involved in joint research projects with ETH.‚ÄØ

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.‚ÄØ

Responsibilities

  • Works within a team to achieve goals and objectives across services, including understanding user requirements, design, and coding.‚ÄØ
  • Brings the State of the Art to Products - collaborates in an interdisciplinary team to bridge the gap between research and development.‚ÄØ
  • Grows expertise in one or more subareas of research.‚ÄØ
  • Develops a deep understanding of tools, technologies and methods that can be utilized to deploy product-grade, robust and efficient code in the cloud.‚ÄØ
  • Grows our relationships with the research community. May contribute to publications, workshops, or the supervision of interns & PhD/MS students.‚ÄØ

Qualifications

Required Qualification(s):‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

  • PhD in Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning or Robotics or similar professional experience.‚ÄØ
  • Demonstrated coding, debugging, and engineering skills in programming languages such as C++ or Python.‚ÄØ
  • Hands-on experience with deep learning and/or computer vision methods.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
  • Self-motivated team-player, problem solver, and keen to learn.‚ÄØ
  • Ability to present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

Preferred Qualifications:‚ÄØ

  • Prior research in one or more of the following areas:‚ÄØ
  • 3D scene reasoning with open vocabularies, Vision-Language Models (VLMs).‚ÄØ
  • Experience with deep learning models like transformers and attention mechanisms for sequence modeling.‚ÄØ
  • Video understanding, action and activity recognition.‚ÄØ
  • Experience with spatio-temporal feature extraction techniques.‚ÄØ
  • Object detection and semantic segmentation.‚ÄØ
  • Robot-environment / robot-human interaction, particularly through natural language.
  • Publication record at top-tier conferences and journals (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV,‚ÄØ NeurIPS, ICLR, CoRL).‚ÄØ

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. Title: Data Science Internship (12 months)
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.

Transforming Waste into Value

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers; we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:


Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).


Qualifications


Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English both written and verbal
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning


Additional Information

We offer


Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Excellent employment conditions
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
Modern infrastructure


For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.
Show more

Title: Research Scientist, Digital Humans
Description:
The application window will be open until at least 03rd April 2025. This opportunity will remain online based on business needs which may be before or after the specified date.Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
One or more scientific publication submission(s) for conferences, journals, or public repositories.
Experience in Coding with Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Computer Vision, Computer Graphics or Machine Learning related disciplines.
Publication track record in conferences such as CVPR, SIGGRAPH, NeurIPS, ECCV, ICCV, ICML, etc.
Experience in C++ or Python programming languages.


About The Job

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

In this role, you will serve a wide range of Google devices/products which are deeply engaged with academia and product. You will work on capturing, animating, generating, and rendering humans as well as simulating their interactions with each other and the environment. You will focus on developing next generation technologies to facilitate realistic data generation, including accurate reconstruction and tracking, physically based animation and simulation, data-driven generative modeling, differential and neural image synthesis.

Labs is a group focused on incubating early-stage efforts in support of Google‚Äôs mission to organize the world‚Äôs information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team exists to help discover and create new ways to advance our core products through exploration and the application of new technologies. We work to build new solutions that have the potential to transform how users interact with Google. Our goal is to drive innovation by developing new Google products and capabilities that deliver significant impact over longer timeframes.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $141,000-$202,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Conduct cutting edge research and publish at venues to advance the state-of-the-art in visual data generation, such as generative modeling, neural representations, neural image synthesis, as well as domain adaptation and data augmentation.
Develop next generation technologies to capture, model, animate, simulate, and synthesize data with a focus on digital humans.
Collaborate cross-functionally with other researchers, engineers, and technical artists, as well as product teams.
Advise and guide junior researchers and PhD students.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
