Title: Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern
Description:
About Corintis




Corintis offers innovative microfluidic cooling technologies for data centers. Our solutions improve compute sustainability and tackle the excessive electricity consumption associated with data center cooling, which consumes more electricity than New York and London combined. By integrating cooling directly inside the chip, we pave the way for the next generation of AI workloads, supporting applications like generative AI systems, climate modeling, and drug discovery to enable the future of sustainable computing.




Working at Corintis




Corintis offers a friendly and team-oriented workplace bringing together a diverse group of nationalities to solve the biggest computing challenges of tomorrow. Based on the EPFL campus near Lausanne, we are closely connected to the local ecosystem and are located a few minutes walk from Lake Geneva.




Job Description




As a Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern at Corintis, you'll play a crucial role by leveraging your skills in Scientific Machine Learning (ML) and Computational Science & Engineering to accelerate the optimization of our groundbreaking microfluidic cooling technology. This role offers an exciting opportunity to directly contribute to the evolution of sustainable computing solutions, including, but not limited to, future AI workloads. In essence, you'll be employing ML to accelerate the design of a cooling system for the very same machine - or its future iteration - enhancing its performance and efficiency.




Responsibilities




Apply ML methods such as Neural Operators for Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) to predict the performance of microfluidics for microchip cooling.
Enhance current ML models and algorithms for improved prediction accuracy and computational efficiency. We would be interested in investigating Group Equivariant Neural Networks for rotation invariance or implementing various data enhancement techniques such as Neural Field Representations, and others.
Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers and scientists to integrate ML solutions into our Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) framework and our design and optimization process.
Continuously monitor and incorporate the latest research and developments in the fields of ML, CFD and topology optimization into our methodologies.
Analyze complex datasets, interpret patterns and trends, and contribute to the evolution of our topology optimization strategies.
Contribute to the formulation of objective functions based on specific design criteria and constraints.
Develop creative and innovative solutions that address the complex challenges of integrating ML, fluid dynamics and microfluidics.




Requirements




Background in computational engineering, computational science, mathematics, physics, or mechanical engineering.
Extensive knowledge of Machine/Deep Learning techniques and architectures.
Proficient in Python and an ML open source library, preferably PyTorch.
Experience in working with open source tools and Git (GitHub).
Interest in CFD and experience with simulation methods.
Ability to think outside of the box and freely discuss creative solutions.
Demonstrated ability to write clear, high-quality technical documentation.
Autonomous and proactive working style with excellent organization and work ethics.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work in a team with diverse professions and cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English.
Please attach a letter of motivation with your CV




Strongly desirable




Experience with training large datasets using GPUs, preferably multi-thread training on High Performance Computing (HPC) Systems.
Familiarity with using Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) for modeling physical phenomena.
Familiarity with the Finite Element Method (FEM) for the numerical solution of PDEs.
Experience in reduced-order modeling for the numerical solution of PDEs and/or scientific ML.
Experience in applying the aforementioned techniques for fluid dynamics problems (Navier-Stokes and/or Darcy flow).




What we offer




A dynamic, flexible, innovative, and multicultural work environment

Start date: Immediately

Contract: Paid Internship (6-months preferred, flexible) 2,500 CHF gross per month

Activity rate: 100%

Location: On-site, Corintis SA (Building C), EPFL Innovation Park, Switzerland

Title: Internship in GenAI/MLOps (m/f) 80-100%
Description:
Local integration of a large language model to accelerate software development

In this internship, you will work at the intersection of Generative AI and MLOps, focusing on the local deployment and integration of a large language model (LLM) to enhance software development workflows. You will take a hands-on approach to setting up, fine-tuning, and integrating an LLM within a sandboxed environment, contributing directly to innovative AI-driven development tools.

You will collaborate closely with a dedicated DevOps team while also receiving guidance from ML engineers through regular meetings and knowledge-sharing sessions. Your work will involve indexing AutoForm‚Äôs code base using LLM-powered semantic search, developing a simple web interface for intuitive code retrieval, and embedding AI-assisted capabilities into an IDE-based copilot. This role provides an opportunity to work with state-of-the-art AI technologies while tackling real-world software engineering challenges.

Your tasks


Set up a large language model in a local sandbox
Index AutoForm's code base using an LLM and elastic search to enable semantic search queries
Create and host a simple web interface allowing to search for code using semantic search
Integrate the LLM into a copilot running in an IDE
Fine-tune model on AutoForm's code base for better results


Your profile


Master's degree (or in the process of obtaining one) in computer science, data science, or engineering
Very good programming skills in Python and familiarity with at least one of the common machine learning frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX
Knowledge of modern neural architectures, especially in natural language processing would be a plus
Basic knowledge in web/app development
Strong technical interest, willingness to get involved in complex technical issues
Team Player with a strong commitment to problem solving
Good knowledge of English required. German would be a plus


Our offer


A challenging role in a respectful and global working environment
Being part of a world-leading, high-end CAE software company
Working on cutting edge technologies for the automotive industry
Professional development and continuous education
Excellent balance between your working life and your private life through flexible working hours


This role is based in Zurich. The duration at 100% workload is 6 months. The minimum workload is 80%, extending the duration accordingly.

Start of work is as soon as possible. Please note that we only consider applicants that have the legal right to work in the respective location. We will only consider direct applications. Please send us your CV and attachments. We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Processing of applicant‚Äôs personal data is based on our Data Privacy Policy

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Description:
Software Engineer, Machine Learning




About Chipmind

Chipmind is transforming chip development with AI-driven agents that automate design and verification by solving real-world tasks, accelerating the path from code to chip.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role at Chipmind for a Software Engineer, Machine Learning¬†focused on post-training and AI agents. Join us to accelerate the path from code to chip and push the boundaries of AI-driven chip development.




What we offer

The opportunity to make an impact on how AI develops chips
A competitive compensation package including company equity
An office in the vibrant Zurich Wiedikon district




Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python and Javascript
Familiar with large language models (LLMs) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Pytorch and TensorFlow)
Familiar with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a strong passion for innovation




Responsibilities

Develop and enhance LLMs and AI agents for improved reasoning and decision-making
Implement RLHF, SFT, DPO, and other post-training methods
Fine-tune LLMs and optimize foundation models
Take part in brainstorming sessions and actively contribute to enhancing our products¬†
Keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends and developments in AI and machine learning technologies
Ensure robust model alignment and performance

Title: AI Engineer Intern
Description:
We‚Äôre a young startup founded in the canton of Uri by a healthy mix of ETH and HSG alumni. Our close-knit team of 10+ is based in Z√ºrich and Altdorf, developing a SaaS solution that helps teams analyze, improve, and track all aspects of their teamwork on a single platform. Our AI-powered teamwork assistant focuses on a team‚Äôs key factors for success: communicating effectively, managing time and resources cooperatively, offering constructive feedback, and many more.




Already more than 60 companies like CSS, Axpo, and Smile rely on Moodtalk. Now we want to scale to 1,000+ companies - and we need your help to get there!




We‚Äôre looking for a talented AI Engineer Intern who‚Äôs curious about exploring teamwork challenges and eager to make an impact. From day one, you‚Äôll be a core member of our team.


Tasks


Your responsibilities‚Ä¶




when developing new AI features will range through the full development cycle:





Understanding customer pain points in close collaboration with our Customer Success team


Selecting the AI tools that balance quality and speed (we ship fast!)


Implementing features in our stack


Evaluating your AI solutions in real-world use cases‚Äîand refining them as needed



Requirements


You‚Äôre the perfect candidate if you have‚Ä¶





Experience applying modern AI to real-world text data‚Äîwhether in class projects (nice!), side projects (even better!), or production (perfect!). We specifically look for experience in:


Writing LLM prompts and flows using common API providers


Building, testing, and deploying agents in lang[chain|graph|flow] (or a comparable agentic framework)


Running inference and/or training transformer models in Hugging Face, PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar


Proficiency in Python and Java (optionally also in Angular or another SPA framework)


Familiarity with a standard toolchain (IntelliJ, Git, Maven, Jira, Confluence)


The curiosity to dig into data until you truly understand the problem at hand


Understanding German is an advantage





If this sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to talk.




Setup & Application





80% - 100% payed internship, minimum duration 3 month, start no later than June (asap possible)


Availability for on-site at least once a week in Z√ºrich Oerlikon


To apply, send us your CV and a two sentence teaser why you‚Äôd be a good match





This is important to us: Moodtalk is an employer where equal opportunity is provided and diversity is celebrated. We welcome people from different backgrounds who want to help us transform teams into true super teams. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Do you want to join one of Switzerlands fastest growing AI SaaS businesses who have a rapidly growing customer base, including Fortune 500 companies? Keep reading!




About the Machine Learning Team

In our Machine Learning team, we are developing cutting-edge solutions for automated document processing. Machine learning is at the heart of our business, and we continuously innovate to enhance the quality and scalability of our AI-driven products. As we scale, you‚Äôll play a key role in maintaining our architecture while solving complex technical challenges.

We use a modern tech stack including Python, Redis, TensorFlow, Docker, RabbitMQ, and microservices deployed on a Kubernetes cluster in the cloud. In this environment, you‚Äôll have a significant opportunity to influence not only the technology but also the organisation‚Äôs growth and culture.




Key Responsibilities

Machine Learning

Translate business problems into technical solutions, selecting the best tools and models to address them.
Develop and maintain transformer-based NLP architectures for improved document processing.
Stay updated with the latest in AI research and apply relevant findings to enhance our machine learning models.
Manage and improve end-to-end prediction services, including model optimisation, data management, and system scalability.




Software Development

Design and build clean, maintainable software solutions using Python, adhering to industry best practices and design patterns to maintain high-quality code.
Conduct code reviews and provide feedback to ensure code quality and consistency across the team.




Requirements

Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in Data Science/Computer Science with a focus on Machine Learning, or equivalent practical experience.
At least 5 years of experience with machine learning algorithms in either academic or industry settings.
Self-motivated with a structured approach to problem-solving and the ability to work autonomously.

Title: Lead Machine Learning Scientist
Company: Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering ‚Äì BIIE
Description:
About the BIIE




The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) is a new interdisciplinary research institute dedicated to innovation in immune engineering. Founded in 2025 through a generous endowment from Fondation Botnar, the BIIE supports scientists in taking on some of the world‚Äôs most challenging problems in immunology and global health. The institute unites experts across immunology, biomedicine, bioengineering, computational biology, artificial intelligence, and machine learning, creating a unique multidisciplinary environment with a mission to make a lasting impact and to train future leaders in immune engineering. BIIE‚Äôs cutting-edge research spans systems immunology, synthetic biology, and computational immunology ‚Äì all underpinned by advanced scientific computing and data analysis.




Position Overview




The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) in Basel is seeking a mid-career Machine Learning Scientist to lead the computational efforts for one of its flagship programs. The flagship program specializes in generating large-scale antibody and T-cell receptor (TCR) datasets for machine learning applications in immune receptor discovery. In this role, you will oversee a small computational team and drive the development of innovative machine learning models for protein design and immune engineering. You will work at the intersection of sequence-based and structure-based protein modeling, leveraging state-of-the-art techniques in deep learning and cloud computing to advance antibody and TCR discovery.


Tasks



Technical Leadership: Lead the design and implementation of ML-driven protein modeling projects, including rapid prototyping of novel algorithms for biological sequence and structure analysis. You will plan and execute experiments with state-of-the-art models to push the boundaries of protein function prediction and design.


Protein Design & Analysis: Develop and apply machine learning methods to predict protein function from sequence and structure, and to design novel proteins (especially antibodies and TCRs) with desired properties. This includes projects focused on protein structure prediction, antibody-antigen interaction modeling, affinity maturation, epitope/paratope analysis, and assessing developability and immunogenicity of engineered proteins.


Data Integration & Pipeline Development: Oversee the curation and integration of large-scale sequence and structural datasets (internal and public) to train and validate models. Ensure robust data pipelines and collaborate with software engineers to maintain high-quality, reproducible analysis workflows, from data preprocessing to model deployment.


Collaborative Research: Work closely with automation and wet-lab scientists in iterative design-build-test cycles. Guide the design of antibodies/TCRs for experimental testing, incorporate experimental feedback into model refinement, and integrate AI/ML approaches into existing antibody engineering workflows. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g. protein engineers, bioinformaticians) to translate computational predictions into real-world therapeutics.


Team Management and Mentoring: Supervise and mentor a small team of junior scientists or engineers. Provide technical guidance, code reviews, and support career development. Foster a collaborative team culture where unblocking colleagues and knowledge sharing are prioritized. Coordinate team efforts and ensure timely delivery of project milestones.


Communication and Reporting: Communicate progress, results, and recommendations clearly to stakeholders. This includes writing reports and presenting findings in group meetings, seminars, or external conferences. As a lead scientist, you will also interface with institute leadership to align on project goals and contribute to strategic decisions for the group.


Innovation and Continuous Learning: Stay current with the latest research in machine learning, bioinformatics, and protein engineering. Explore emerging techniques (e.g. protein language models or generative diffusion models) and evaluate their potential to improve project objectives. Proactively propose and implement novel solutions (technical or algorithmic) that keep the group at the cutting-edge of AI-driven protein design.



Requirements


Education




Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biophysics or a related field. A strong background at the interface of machine learning and biology is essential. Candidates should have a few years of postdoctoral or industry experience beyond the PhD, demonstrating the application of ML to biological problems. A solid publication record or equivalent research impact (e.g. influential projects or tools) is expected for this role.




Experience:





Machine Learning Expertise: Demonstrated expertise in modern machine learning and deep learning techniques. Hands-on experience developing and training deep neural networks from scratch and fine-tuning existing models. Proficiency with deep learning frameworks (such as PyTorch and/or TensorFlow) and libraries for data science (Pandas, scikit-learn, etc.) is required. Familiarity with large-scale models (e.g. transformer-based protein language models or diffusion models for protein design) is a plus.


Computational Biology & Protein Modeling: In-depth knowledge of computational protein science. Experience with sequence-based and structure-based protein modeling tools is highly sought after. For example, proficiency in using or customizing tools like AlphaFold, RoseTTAFold, Rosetta, ProteinMPNN, or RFDiffusion for protein structure prediction and design is expected. Exposure to antibody-specific modeling (e.g. antibody structure prediction, paratope-epitope mapping) and general bioinformatics tools (BLAST, Biopython, PyMOL for visualization) will be beneficial.


Domain Knowledge: Strong understanding of protein engineering and developability considerations for therapeutic proteins (e.g. stability, aggregation, immunogenicity). Prior experience in antibody or TCR discovery is a major advantage ‚Äì for instance, knowledge of antibody sequence databases, immune repertoire analysis, or lab techniques for antibody characterization. The ideal candidate can connect biological insights with ML modeling, ensuring that computational work is biologically relevant and translatable.


Programming and Data Skills: Excellent programming skills in Python (scientific computing and scripting). Competence in data handling ‚Äî ability to work with large-scale datasets (omics, sequencing, structural data) and perform data analysis, visualization, and pipeline automation. Experience with version control (Git/GitHub) and working in Linux/Unix environments is beneficial for collaborative code development.


Cloud Computing & HPC: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and high-performance computing environments for running large experiments. This includes familiarity with cloud-based GPU/TPU instances, cluster job scheduling, and containerization (Docker/Singularity) to deploy and scale models. Ability to optimize workflows for efficiency and cost-effectiveness in the cloud is expected.


Teamwork and Leadership: Proven ability to work productively in interdisciplinary teams. Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset are essential. You should have experience leading projects or small teams, including coordinating with diverse experts (wet-lab scientists, engineers, data specialists). A mentorship-oriented attitude is important ‚Äì we value leaders who help train others and build an inclusive, innovative team culture.


Problem-Solving and Innovation: A passion for tackling challenging scientific problems with AI. The candidate should be creative, curious, and self-motivated, with the determination to drive projects to completion. Evidence of innovation ‚Äì such as developing a novel algorithm, pipeline, or insight in prior work ‚Äì will distinguish the candidate. We seek someone who stays abreast of new developments and can quickly learn and integrate new methods for the group‚Äôs benefit.





Preferred Qualifications (Bonus Skills)





Immunology Domain Experience: Familiarity with immunological data and concepts, such as B-cell receptor/TCR repertoire analysis, antibody engineering (e.g. humanization, affinity maturation techniques), or immunoassay data interpretation. While not strictly required, the ability to contextualize machine learning results within the domain of immune engineering will allow for a bigger project impact.


Track Record of Impact: A history of leading successful ML projects in biotech or academia, evidenced by high-impact publications, patents, or contributions to products and pipelines. Experience in translating computational research into tangible outcomes (like a new therapeutic candidate or a deployed tool) is highly valued.


Project Management: Skills in project planning and resource management. For instance, experience in managing project timelines or coordinating collaborations will be useful in this role (the institute encourages scientific leadership and may offer opportunities for you to direct projects or funding initiatives).





Joining BIIE as a Lead Machine Learning Scientist offers a unique opportunity to have a profound impact on a growing institute at the forefront of immune engineering innovation. You will be a key contributor to groundbreaking research in immune engineering, directly enabling discoveries that could transform healthcare and save lives.




If you are an experienced ML scientist with a passion for science and innovation, we encourage you to apply and join us in building a world-class computing environment at BIIE. Together, we will empower researchers to push the boundaries of immune engineering and make a real difference in the world.

The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) is a new interdisciplinary research institute dedicated to innovation in immune engineering. Founded in 2025 through a generous endowment from Fondation Botnar, the BIIE supports scientists in taking on some of the world‚Äôs most challenging problems in immunology and global health. The institute unites experts across immunology, biomedicine, bioengineering, computational biology, artificial intelligence, and machine learning, creating a unique multidisciplinary environment with a mission to make a lasting impact and to train future leaders in immune engineering. BIIE‚Äôs cutting-edge research spans systems immunology, synthetic biology, and computational immunology ‚Äì all underpinned by advanced scientific computing and data analysis.


Position Overview


The Botnar Institute of Immune Engineering (BIIE) in Basel is seeking a mid-career Machine Learning Scientist to lead the computational efforts for one of its flagship programs. The flagship program specializes in generating large-scale antibody and T-cell receptor (TCR) datasets for machine learning applications in immune receptor discovery. In this role, you will oversee a small computational team and drive the development of innovative machine learning models for protein design and immune engineering. You will work at the intersection of sequence-based and structure-based protein modeling, leveraging state-of-the-art techniques in deep learning and cloud computing to advance antibody and TCR discovery.


Tasks

  • Technical Leadership: Lead the design and implementation of ML-driven protein modeling projects, including rapid prototyping of novel algorithms for biological sequence and structure analysis. You will plan and execute experiments with state-of-the-art models to push the boundaries of protein function prediction and design.

  • Protein Design & Analysis: Develop and apply machine learning methods to predict protein function from sequence and structure, and to design novel proteins (especially antibodies and TCRs) with desired properties. This includes projects focused on protein structure prediction, antibody-antigen interaction modeling, affinity maturation, epitope/paratope analysis, and assessing developability and immunogenicity of engineered proteins.

  • Data Integration & Pipeline Development: Oversee the curation and integration of large-scale sequence and structural datasets (internal and public) to train and validate models. Ensure robust data pipelines and collaborate with software engineers to maintain high-quality, reproducible analysis workflows, from data preprocessing to model deployment.

  • Collaborative Research: Work closely with automation and wet-lab scientists in iterative design-build-test cycles. Guide the design of antibodies/TCRs for experimental testing, incorporate experimental feedback into model refinement, and integrate AI/ML approaches into existing antibody engineering workflows. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g. protein engineers, bioinformaticians) to translate computational predictions into real-world therapeutics.

  • Team Management and Mentoring: Supervise and mentor a small team of junior scientists or engineers. Provide technical guidance, code reviews, and support career development. Foster a collaborative team culture where unblocking colleagues and knowledge sharing are prioritized. Coordinate team efforts and ensure timely delivery of project milestones.

  • Communication and Reporting: Communicate progress, results, and recommendations clearly to stakeholders. This includes writing reports and presenting findings in group meetings, seminars, or external conferences. As a lead scientist, you will also interface with institute leadership to align on project goals and contribute to strategic decisions for the group.

  • Innovation and Continuous Learning: Stay current with the latest research in machine learning, bioinformatics, and protein engineering. Explore emerging techniques (e.g. protein language models or generative diffusion models) and evaluate their potential to improve project objectives. Proactively propose and implement novel solutions (technical or algorithmic) that keep the group at the cutting-edge of AI-driven protein design.


Requirements

Education


Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biophysics or a related field. A strong background at the interface of machine learning and biology is essential. Candidates should have a few years of postdoctoral or industry experience beyond the PhD, demonstrating the application of ML to biological problems. A solid publication record or equivalent research impact (e.g. influential projects or tools) is expected for this role.


Experience:



  • Machine Learning Expertise: Demonstrated expertise in modern machine learning and deep learning techniques. Hands-on experience developing and training deep neural networks from scratch and fine-tuning existing models. Proficiency with deep learning frameworks (such as PyTorch and/or TensorFlow) and libraries for data science (Pandas, scikit-learn, etc.) is required. Familiarity with large-scale models (e.g. transformer-based protein language models or diffusion models for protein design) is a plus.

  • Computational Biology & Protein Modeling: In-depth knowledge of computational protein science. Experience with sequence-based and structure-based protein modeling tools is highly sought after. For example, proficiency in using or customizing tools like AlphaFold, RoseTTAFold, Rosetta, ProteinMPNN, or RFDiffusion for protein structure prediction and design is expected. Exposure to antibody-specific modeling (e.g. antibody structure prediction, paratope-epitope mapping) and general bioinformatics tools (BLAST, Biopython, PyMOL for visualization) will be beneficial.

  • Domain Knowledge: Strong understanding of protein engineering and developability considerations for therapeutic proteins (e.g. stability, aggregation, immunogenicity). Prior experience in antibody or TCR discovery is a major advantage ‚Äì for instance, knowledge of antibody sequence databases, immune repertoire analysis, or lab techniques for antibody characterization. The ideal candidate can connect biological insights with ML modeling, ensuring that computational work is biologically relevant and translatable.

  • Programming and Data Skills: Excellent programming skills in Python (scientific computing and scripting). Competence in data handling ‚Äî ability to work with large-scale datasets (omics, sequencing, structural data) and perform data analysis, visualization, and pipeline automation. Experience with version control (Git/GitHub) and working in Linux/Unix environments is beneficial for collaborative code development.

  • Cloud Computing & HPC: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and high-performance computing environments for running large experiments. This includes familiarity with cloud-based GPU/TPU instances, cluster job scheduling, and containerization (Docker/Singularity) to deploy and scale models. Ability to optimize workflows for efficiency and cost-effectiveness in the cloud is expected.

  • Teamwork and Leadership: Proven ability to work productively in interdisciplinary teams. Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset are essential. You should have experience leading projects or small teams, including coordinating with diverse experts (wet-lab scientists, engineers, data specialists). A mentorship-oriented attitude is important ‚Äì we value leaders who help train others and build an inclusive, innovative team culture.

  • Problem-Solving and Innovation: A passion for tackling challenging scientific problems with AI. The candidate should be creative, curious, and self-motivated, with the determination to drive projects to completion. Evidence of innovation ‚Äì such as developing a novel algorithm, pipeline, or insight in prior work ‚Äì will distinguish the candidate. We seek someone who stays abreast of new developments and can quickly learn and integrate new methods for the group‚Äôs benefit.


Preferred Qualifications (Bonus Skills)



  • Immunology Domain Experience: Familiarity with immunological data and concepts, such as B-cell receptor/TCR repertoire analysis, antibody engineering (e.g. humanization, affinity maturation techniques), or immunoassay data interpretation. While not strictly required, the ability to contextualize machine learning results within the domain of immune engineering will allow for a bigger project impact.

  • Track Record of Impact: A history of leading successful ML projects in biotech or academia, evidenced by high-impact publications, patents, or contributions to products and pipelines. Experience in translating computational research into tangible outcomes (like a new therapeutic candidate or a deployed tool) is highly valued.

  • Project Management: Skills in project planning and resource management. For instance, experience in managing project timelines or coordinating collaborations will be useful in this role (the institute encourages scientific leadership and may offer opportunities for you to direct projects or funding initiatives).


Joining BIIE as a Lead Machine Learning Scientist offers a unique opportunity to have a profound impact on a growing institute at the forefront of immune engineering innovation. You will be a key contributor to groundbreaking research in immune engineering, directly enabling discoveries that could transform healthcare and save lives.


If you are an experienced ML scientist with a passion for science and innovation, we encourage you to apply and join us in building a world-class computing environment at BIIE. Together, we will empower researchers to push the boundaries of immune engineering and make a real difference in the world.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Gemini Safety
Description:
Snapshot

You are an experienced Machine Learning Engineer with a strong engineering and research background who is excited about improving safety and alignment of the "Gemini" end-user product, delivering state-of-the art language models to our users.

About Us

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity‚Äôs most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we‚Äôre a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

The role

Our team works on developing safe, aligned, and helpful Gemini models across all modalities (text, images, audio) as well as novel ways of evaluating them through superhuman autoraters or automated red teaming.

To that end, we are advancing the state-of-the-art on the entire post-training pipeline. This includes innovations in RLHF/RL*F tailored to safety and alignment, novel and scalable ways of evaluating models to find weaknesses, as well as improvements in model understanding to guide future research.

We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer excited to push the state of the art in these areas.

Key responsibilities


Apply and innovate on state-of-the-art modeling techniques with the goal of reducing safety violations while increasing human alignment using post-training approaches (e.g. SFT, RLHF/RL*F).
Collaborate with peers and cross-functional research teams on applying state-of-the-art machine learning approaches to LLM-based products.
Propose and quickly prototype novel ideas and implement advances in Gemini's production systems.
Have bias for action: our team operates in a high-reward and fast-paced environment.
In summary: we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with strong intuition and the ability to drive ambiguous projects end-to-end to push the boundaries of Safety and Alignment on LLMs.


About You

In order to set you up for success as a machine learning-focused software engineer at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:


MSc degree in computer science or machine learning or similar experience working in industry.
3+ years of experience with ML modeling and generative AI, working with data, model evaluations, and quality iterations.
Proven knowledge and experience of Python, one or several machine learning frameworks (Jax, TensorFlow, or PyTorch), as well as algorithms and data structures.
Ability to grow in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.


In addition, the following would be an advantage:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with training and optimizing large language models.


At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Application deadline: 12pm GMT Friday April 16th 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
mesoneer ist eine der f√ºhrenden Schweizer Softwareschmieden in den Bereichen Digital Onboarding, Prozessautomatisierung sowie Integration komplexer Umsysteme. Unsere rund 120 Mitarbeitenden in der Schweiz und Vietnam digitalisieren und vereinfachen Businessprozesse mit individuellen Softwarel√∂sungen, modernisieren veraltete Anwendungen und entwickeln hauseigene SaaS-L√∂sungen. F√ºr unsere Kunden aus der Finanz- und Versicherungsbranche, der √∂ffentlichen Verwaltung oder der Industrie brauchen wir dich!




Was dich erwartet

Analyse von Kundenanforderungen und Konzeption von L√∂sungsarchitekturen auf Basis modernster AI-Technologien.
Entwicklung und Implementierung von AI-Modellen (z.B. mittels RAG und AI Agents) zur Bearbeitung komplexer Gesch√§ftsanforderungen.
Integration und Optimierung von AI-L√∂sungen in bestehende Software- und Cloud-Umgebungen.
Kontinuierliche Evaluation neuer AI-Technologien hinsichtlich Praxistauglichkeit und Mehrwert.
Sicherstellung von Skalierbarkeit, Sicherheit und Performance der entwickelten AI-Anwendungen.
Durchf√ºhrung von AI-Workshops beim Kunden und eigenverantwortliche Leitung von AI-Projekten, vom Konzept bis zur Umsetzung




Was du mitbringst

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einer verwandten Fachrichtungen.
Mehrj√§hrige Praxiserfahrung in der Entwicklung und dem operativen Einsatz von AI- und Machine-Learning-L√∂sungen.
Tiefgehende Kenntnisse in Python, sowie fundierte praktische Erfahrung mit TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain oder vergleichbaren Frameworks.
Erfahrung im Einsatz von Cloud-Plattformen (insbesondere Microsoft Azure Cloud) sowie Integration und Anwendung von OpenAI-Technologien.
Praxis in der Nutzung und lokalen Implementierung von Open-Source-LLMs.
Vertrautheit mit modernen Datenplattformen und -technologien wie Azure Fabric, Snowflake und Kafka.
Strukturierte, eigenst√§ndige und l√∂sungsorientierte Arbeitsweise.
Starke Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten und ausgepr√§gte Teamorientierung.
Fliessend Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift.




Warum wirst du die Arbeit bei mesoneer lieben?

Flexible, moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle & Work from Home
Frei an deinem Geburtstag (zus√§tzlicher Urlaubstag)
Selbst√§ndiges Arbeiten und flache Hierarchien
Modernste Arbeitsmittel und Methoden
Teamevents & Fun




Unser hoch motiviertes und unterst√ºtzendes Team lebt eine offene Fehlerkultur und pflegt intensiven Wissensaustausch. Bei uns bist du nicht nur eine Nummer, sondern kannst dich tats√§chlich mit deinen Ideen einbringen, an sinnvollen Projekten arbeiten und Dinge weiterentwickeln. Title: Data Science Internship / Working Student
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as; data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments


Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss


What We Offer


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultural environment
Working with senior tech leads
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


at least one programming/scripting language
database technologies and a query language
data engineering and science basics


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage


Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: 2025 Off-cycle Internship ‚Äì GWM Data Scientist CIO ‚Äì ZH
Description:
Job Reference #

314900BR

City

Z√ºrich, Switzerland - Z√ºrich

Your role

Interested in working in finance, specifically as a wealth management professional serving clients, but not sure where to start? Do you want to work for a firm with a truly global footprint that consistently ranks among the world's top financial institutions? Are you passionate about mixing technology to derive business value and excited by the prospect of helping to drive and deliver change that will positively impact the way every research analyst works in the GWM Chief Investment Office (CIO)?

We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2025 Off-cycle Internship Program within our Global Wealth Management business.

You‚Äôll get to


support the delivery of solutions that improve the productivity and effectiveness of analysts' community within CIO
support building a modern cloud-based data platform
generate insights and models based on transactional and behavioral data
collaborate with different teams on strategic projects with a goal of improving our client experience and driving engagement
build an understanding of our industry, culture, and strategy, while learning about how we operate to effectively meet the needs of our clients
develop professionally by establishing a network of mentors and business contacts we believe are some of the best in the business
attend educational events led by senior leaders that provide extensive exposure and insight into the business



Your team

You‚Äôll be working in our Global Wealth Management team in Z√ºrich. We provide advice-based solutions to deliver products and services designed to address the needs of ultra-high net worth and high-net worth individuals and families. We‚Äôve successfully built the number one wealth management franchise in the world. You‚Äôll work with the best talent in the industry, as we help manage, preserve and grow the wealth of our clients.

You will be part of the CIO Data Analytics team in Chief Investment Office (CIO) in our Zurich location. Our Data team is at the heart of CIO to manage and support data science efforts across different business areas. It is a global team based in Switzerland. At the heart of this project is the ability to systematically analyze and build models supporting business to make data driven decisions. Our focus is always the client!

Your expertise

We‚Äôre looking for a candidate who


has completed at least 4 semesters of a bachelor's degree, and graduated no longer than six months ago (bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in an analytical field e.g. Statistics, Physics, Finance, IT, Engineering)
has strong analytical and problem-solving skills, propensity to move from prototyping to concrete implementation avoiding ‚Äúanalysis paralysis‚Äù
has hands on experience with one or more programming languages (i.e. Python, R, NodeJs), Python is a must
has hands on experience with data science libraries like scikit, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow
is experienced with scripting languages (bash, etc.)
has an understanding of a broad range of platforms and technologies (e.g. GitLab, Jenkins, AirFlow)
has an understanding of Agile Development's best practices
has high level of curiosity and awareness of emerging technologies, particularly in large language models like ChatGPT
has values that align with ours hard-working, trustworthy, dedicated and collaborative
is a strategic thinker with strong communication skills
is motivated to work in a business with high demands and tight deadlines


We‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it‚Äôs important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team. Perhaps you‚Äôve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or stepped out of your comfort zone to learn about a subject you found challenging? Let us know how your achievements match the skills we‚Äôre after.

Start Date May or June 2025

About Us

UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us the conviction that we‚Äôre stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.

Join us

We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. You‚Äôll get to learn from the best at UBS, inspirational leaders from across the business and experts in everything financial industry. Together we‚Äôre more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Auf den Punkt gebracht

Du bist begeistert von den M√∂glichkeiten des Machine Learnings? Findest du den Einsatz f√ºr eine sichere und freie Schweiz cool? Die F√ºhrung, Steuerung und Koordination s√§mtlicher √ºbergreifender Querschnittsbereiche (Personal, Finanzen, Immobilien) fallen ebenfalls in den Zust√§ndigkeitsbereich des Armeestabs.

Die Schweizer Armee besch√§ftigt √ºber 9'000 Mitarbeitende in vier milit√§rischen und rund 200 zivilen Berufen ‚Äì und dies an 110 Standorten schweizweit. Auch f√ºr den Nachwuchs ist gesorgt: Die Schweizer Armee bildet in √ºber 30 Berufen Lernende aus.

Das bieten wir

Arbeiten f√ºr die SchweizWir setzen uns f√ºr das Erfolgsmodell Schweiz ein und arbeiten zum Wohl der Bev√∂lkerung.

Gelebte VielfaltDank Chancengleichheit entfalten wir unsere Kompetenzen und bringen unterschiedliche Perspektiven ein.

Gesund am ArbeitsplatzWir unterst√ºtzen und beraten unsere Mitarbeitenden im Bereich der physischen und psychischen Gesundheit.

Title: Global Sr Data Scientist
Description:
Nestl√© Health Science is a globally recognized leader in the science of nutrition, with more than 11,000 employees around the world. With a portfolio of science-based consumer health, medical nutrition, vitamin and supplement brands, and pharmaceutical therapies, we are redefining the management of health.

Position Snapshot

Location: Flexible (FR, DE, Switzerland and Spain)

Company: Nestl√© Health Science

Act. Rate: Full-Time Act. Rate 100%

Type of contract: Permanent contract

What We Offer At Nestl√©

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way; across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.

A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.

Don‚Äôt hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

The NHSc Global Senior Data Scientist will design, develop, and deploy statistical and algorithmic solutions to address complex business challenges. You will analyze large, diverse data sets, formulate testing strategies, and validate hypotheses to deliver actionable insights. Collaborating with Data Engineers, you will industrialize scalable solutions and demonstrate expertise in data preparation, statistical modeling, report writing, and insight generation.

A day in the life of a NHSc Global Senior Data Scientist


Develop and execute product/project roadmap.
Determine data requirements for training and developing models.
Prepare data, variables, models, tests, and validate hypotheses to answer business questions.
Prove or invalidate hypotheses to address business questions.
Coach and mentor junior data scientists or analysts (internal or external).
Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Identify opportunities to optimize investments and deployments in data across markets.
Coordinate projects and present initiatives to all stakeholders, recommending best practices.


What Will Make You Successful


Master's Degree or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning).
Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in data science within applied analytics.
Proficiency in advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques.
Proven track record of solving complex business problems using statistics and machine learning.
Exceptional communication skills for engaging both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a product-oriented mindset.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders across various teams and organizational levels.
Deep understanding of E-commerce domains, with sales expertise being a plus.
Industry expertise in FMCG is needed, experience in consumer health/pharma is a plus.
Proven ability to mentor, coach, and develop junior data scientists and analysts.


Nestl√© is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

Nutrition can be life-transforming for those who need extra support during short- or long-term medical challenges, and it can enhance the quality of life of those who are already healthy.‚ÄØ‚ÄØWith an‚ÄØextensive‚ÄØresearch network‚ÄØproviding‚ÄØthe foundation for products that can help people to live their healthiest lives, our‚ÄØcommitment to science-based products means that we provide nutritional solutions that can make a real difference in the quality of life of customers, patients, and caregivers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Find out more about Nestl√© Health Science at Nestlehealthscience.com.

At Nestl√©, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win. We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people‚Äôs lives that we touch every single day.

Be a force for good. Join Nestl√© and visit us on www.nestle.com.

Title: Data Science Internship in Real World Data - Cardiovascular Risk Prediction
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

At Roche, we believe it‚Äôs urgent to deliver medical solutions right now ‚Äì even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients‚Äô lives, and we are fearless in both making decisions and taking action. And we believe that good business means a better world.

That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.

The Opportunity:

You will be part of the Real World Data Science (RWDS) team and will be located in Basel. As part of the wider Data Science and Analytics department in the Late Stage Development unit of Roche‚Äôs Pharma division, we provide expertise in the conceptualisation, design, conduct and interpretation of RWD studies to help the development of and access to Roche‚Äôs medicines.

In this position, You will:


Explore existing AI-driven cardiovascular risk scores using real-world data to identify the impact of dynamic biomarker changes on risk estimation and treatment efficacy
Develop and validate a machine learning algorithm to improve cardiovascular risk prediction based on lab-measured biomarker changes over time (e.g., NT-proBNP, hsCRP, lipids)
Collaborate with experts in the Cardiovascular and Metabolic area to combine data science with clinical insights and prioritize key biomarkers for enhanced risk prediction
Document and share your findings and recommendations to influence future cardiovascular research and trial designs
Work with large-scale datasets and AI/ML techniques, gaining valuable professional experience and contributing to cutting-edge advancements at Roche


Who you are:

You have earned an M.Sc. within the past 12 months prior to the start date, or you are currently enrolled in a Master's degree or PhD program in data science, epidemiology, statistics, or a similar quantitative discipline, and have very good knowledge of programming in R or Python.

Successful applicants will demonstrate a keen interest to learn about new data, tools and methods, to experiment, and to complete the internship project within the allocated time. Prior experience and/or a keen interest in the specific project areas are a plus.

Moreover, you are:


Experienced or have a strong willingness to learn both analysis of large claims or electronic medical records data and report/publication writing
A person who works systematically and precisely and brings a high level of initiative as well as a dedicated attitude
A proactive and transparent team worker
Proficient in English
Experienced with machine learning for prognostic modelling (ideally on time series data) and/or familiarity with cardiovascular risk scores and biomarkers (e.g., NT-proBNP, hsCRP, cholesterol) is a plus


To be considered, please send us your:


CV
Motivation Letter (including desired start date & duration)
A certificate of enrolment (if you are currently studying)
Due to regulations, Non-EU/non-EFTA citizens are required to submit a certificate of enrolment along with an official letter from their university confirming that the internship is a mandatory component of their studies. The letter also must specify the duration of the required internship


Starting June 2025 or, upon availability, for 4‚Äì6 months.

Willing to spend the majority of time on campus in Basel.

If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients‚Äô lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark and improve lives, apply now!

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
ATTIVITA‚Äô:


  • Sviluppare modelli predittivi end-to-end per tutte le BU, quali Marketing, Trading e Gaming;
  • Monitoraggio e troubleshooting dei processi/modelli in essere;
  • Gestire i modelli di segmentazione, propensity scoring e regressione supportandone l‚Äôanalisi descrittiva;
  • Monitorare i risultati del pLTV dei clienti e del loro relativo ROI, con focus sui diversi canali di acquisizione;
  • Realizzare, con il dipartimento IT, modelli predittivi integrati ai processi di vendita;
  • Creare matematiche di gioco effettuando simulazioni in python per il calcolo dell RTP;
  • Realizzare modelli integrati con Open AI- GPT4 (o altri LLM affini);
  • Integrazione dati, web scraping e Data Foundation.


CARATTERISTICHE:


  • Laurea in Matematica/Statistica/Ingegneria o equivalenti;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei sistemi di analisti statistica, delle tecniche di Data Mining e ML attraverso almeno uno dei seguenti software: Python, PySpark;
  • Almeno due anni di esperienza nelle fasi di realizzazione di un modello predittivo;
  • Aver realizzato un modello predittivo End-to-End, in ambito MLops;
  • Forte interesse verso la matematica, in particolare nell‚Äôambito della Teoria dei giochi;
  • Conoscenza base della piattaforma Google Cloud;
  • Risulta un plus la conoscenza del software Tableau: dall‚Äôestrazione dei dati alla creazione di dashboard utili a diffondere l‚Äôinformazione dei dati ai propri colleghi;
  • Risulta un plus interesse/esperienza in ambito di integrazione di LLM;
  • Conoscenza base della lingua inglese;
  • Buone capacit√† organizzative, determinazione e un atteggiamento costruttivo nell'affrontare i problemi;
  • Capacit√† di gestire con confidenzialit√† le informazioni con le quali si entra in contatto;
  • Buona propensione al lavoro in team, spirito di iniziativa e condivisione;
  • La passione per gli sport di maggiore interesse in Italia √® titolo preferenziale non essenziale.


Entra a far parte della nostra azienda: ecco quello che abbiamo riservato per te!


  • Lavoro flessibile con modello di Smart Working consolidato;
  • I nostri uffici sono sempre aperti: il contatto, il clima aziendale e il confronto con i tuoi colleghi/e sono la nostra forza per trovare sempre l‚Äôispirazione giusta;
  • Ticket restaurant giornalieri, sia nei giorni on site che quando lavori da remoto;
  • Assicurazione Sanitaria integrativa per te e la tua famiglia;
  • Agevolazione sull‚Äôacquisto dell‚Äôabbonamento ai trasporti pubblici;
  • Un programma di Wellbeing che si rinnova continuamente: Padel, Yoga, Canottaggio per i pi√π sportivi, lo sportello counseling e percorsi di formazione sul benessere e sulla resilienza sono solo alcune delle attivit√† a cui potrai accedere;
  • Progetti strutturati sulla DE&I.

Title: Machine Learning Developer
Description:
Chi siamo

EUforLEGAL Srl, √® una realt√† innovativa nata per offrire soluzioni applicative, servizi e prodotti per il mercato Legaltech, un mercato in grande crescita a livello globale, per l'informatizzazione e automazione delle aree legali di grandi organizzazioni pubbliche e private e di prestigiose law firm.

Abbiamo una pluriennale esperienza d'ambito maturata presso prestigiosi clienti sui processi e tecnologie di Knowledge Management (KM) ed Enterprise Legal Management (ELM) nei sistemi informativi legali.

Le nostre applicazioni di Legal AI generano conoscenza grazie all'utilizzo di modelli di Statistical/Machine Learning, Deep Learning, con l'obiettivo di aumentare la produttivit√†, supportare le decisioni strategiche, offrire un valore aggiunto ai processi aziendali interni e semplificare le attivit√† di gestione delle pratiche legali.




Per il rafforzamento del team AI, siamo alla ricerca di Machine learning Developer che siano parte attiva delle iniziative legate all'intelligenza artificiale all'interno dell'azienda. Le risorse inserite supporteranno l‚Äôazienda nelle strategie di crescita attraverso l‚Äôutilizzo delle moderne tecnologie e Modelli IA per il mercato Legaltech e Regtech.




Descrizione del profilo

Stiamo selezionando brillanti neolaureati/profili Junior in materie STEM con una forte passione vero il mondo della programmazione e dell‚Äôinnovazione. Le risorse saranno inserite all‚Äôinterno di un team di specialisti AI e collaboreranno allo sviluppo e alla messa in produzione di modelli di machine learning, con un focus particolare su progetti/prodotti legati all‚Äôelaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP) e alla Generative AI (es. LLM). I candidati ideali avranno una buona esperienza nella programmazione Python e nell'uso dei principali framework e librerie di machine learning.

Le risorse contribuiranno a progetti/prodotti innovativi, implementando e validando soluzioni basate su tecniche avanzate di deep learning e NLP, come Named Entity Recognition (NER), Topic Detecion, Smart Search, e molto altro. Saranno in grado di creare modelli di machine learning su larga scala, sfruttando architetture di deep learning come RNN, BERT, e utilizzando le tecniche pi√π avanzate della Generative AI come il prompt-engineering, il fine-tuning e il retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) sui principali modelli di LLM come LLaMA e GPT.




Requisiti di conoscenza, competenze ed abilit√†

Buona padronanza della programmazione Python e dei framework di machine learning, tra cui:
PyTorch
TensorFlow
Keras
SciKit Learn
Huggingface
Esperienza/conoscenza teorica nella conduzione e realizzazione di progetti NLP (ad esempio: NER, Topic Detecion) e capacit√† di lavorare con modelli su diverse applicazioni.
Buona esperienza nella creazione e messa in produzione di modelli di machine learning
Esperienza/conoscenza teorica delle architetture di deep learning come RNN, BERT, LLMe capacit√† di applicarle ai progetti.
Esperienza/conoscenza teorica di tecniche di prompt-engineering, fine-tuning e RAG su modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLMs) come LLaMA e GPT.
Familiarit√† con pipeline DevOps e MLOps per l'integrazione e la distribuzione continua di modelli ML su larga scala.




Percorso formativo

Laurea Magistrale in ambito scientifico (Data Science, Statistica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Informatica, ecc.)
Costituiscono un plus: formazione integrativa, aver conseguito certificazioni di settore e corsi certificati su piattaforme MOOC (es. Coursera, Udemy, ecc.).




Completano il profilo

Capacit√† di lavorare in team e ottime doti relazionali.
Spirito innovativo, curiosit√† e proattivit√†.
Capacit√† di apprendimento rapido e problem-solving pragmatico
Ottime capacit√† di comunicazione e conoscenza dell'inglese




Sede di lavoro: Roma

Chi siamo

EUforLEGAL Srl, √® una realt√† innovativa nata per offrire soluzioni applicative, servizi e prodotti per il mercato Legaltech, un mercato in grande crescita a livello globale, per l'informatizzazione e automazione delle aree legali di grandi organizzazioni pubbliche e private e di prestigiose law firm.

Abbiamo una pluriennale esperienza d'ambito maturata presso prestigiosi clienti sui processi e tecnologie di Knowledge Management (KM) ed Enterprise Legal Management (ELM) nei sistemi informativi legali.

Le nostre applicazioni di Legal AI generano conoscenza grazie all'utilizzo di modelli di Statistical/Machine Learning, Deep Learning, con l'obiettivo di aumentare la produttivit√†, supportare le decisioni strategiche, offrire un valore aggiunto ai processi aziendali interni e semplificare le attivit√† di gestione delle pratiche legali.


Per il rafforzamento del team AI, siamo alla ricerca di Machine learning Developer che siano parte attiva delle iniziative legate all'intelligenza artificiale all'interno dell'azienda. Le risorse inserite supporteranno l‚Äôazienda nelle strategie di crescita attraverso l‚Äôutilizzo delle moderne tecnologie e Modelli IA per il mercato Legaltech e Regtech.


Descrizione del profilo

Stiamo selezionando brillanti neolaureati/profili Junior in materie STEM con una forte passione vero il mondo della programmazione e dell‚Äôinnovazione. Le risorse saranno inserite all‚Äôinterno di un team di specialisti AI e collaboreranno allo sviluppo e alla messa in produzione di modelli di machine learning, con un focus particolare su progetti/prodotti legati all‚Äôelaborazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP) e alla Generative AI (es. LLM). I candidati ideali avranno una buona esperienza nella programmazione Python e nell'uso dei principali framework e librerie di machine learning.

Le risorse contribuiranno a progetti/prodotti innovativi, implementando e validando soluzioni basate su tecniche avanzate di deep learning e NLP, come Named Entity Recognition (NER), Topic Detecion, Smart Search, e molto altro. Saranno in grado di creare modelli di machine learning su larga scala, sfruttando architetture di deep learning come RNN, BERT, e utilizzando le tecniche pi√π avanzate della Generative AI come il prompt-engineering, il fine-tuning e il retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) sui principali modelli di LLM come LLaMA e GPT.


Requisiti di conoscenza, competenze ed abilit√†

  • Buona padronanza della programmazione Python e dei framework di machine learning, tra cui:
  • PyTorch
  • TensorFlow
  • Keras
  • SciKit Learn
  • Huggingface
  • Esperienza/conoscenza teorica nella conduzione e realizzazione di progetti NLP (ad esempio: NER, Topic Detecion) e capacit√† di lavorare con modelli su diverse applicazioni.
  • Buona esperienza nella creazione e messa in produzione di modelli di machine learning
  • Esperienza/conoscenza teorica delle architetture di deep learning come RNN, BERT, LLMe capacit√† di applicarle ai progetti.
  • Esperienza/conoscenza teorica di tecniche di prompt-engineering, fine-tuning e RAG su modelli di linguaggio di grandi dimensioni (LLMs) come LLaMA e GPT.
  • Familiarit√† con pipeline DevOps e MLOps per l'integrazione e la distribuzione continua di modelli ML su larga scala.


Percorso formativo

  • Laurea Magistrale in ambito scientifico (Data Science, Statistica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Informatica, ecc.)
  • Costituiscono un plus: formazione integrativa, aver conseguito certificazioni di settore e corsi certificati su piattaforme MOOC (es. Coursera, Udemy, ecc.).


Completano il profilo

  • Capacit√† di lavorare in team e ottime doti relazionali.
  • Spirito innovativo, curiosit√† e proattivit√†.
  • Capacit√† di apprendimento rapido e problem-solving pragmatico
  • Ottime capacit√† di comunicazione e conoscenza dell'inglese

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
JPREF:#INN082025


Stiamo cercando nuovi talenti per accrescere il nostro team in OpenEconomics (OE)!


Siamo un'azienda leader nel settore della modellazione dell'impatto economico, dedicata a fornire strumenti e soluzioni di analisi econometrica all'avanguardia per aziende, governi e il settore finanziario. La nostra missione √® dotare i nostri clienti di insight basati sui dati per un processo decisionale informato e una pianificazione strategica, consentendo loro di adattarsi efficacemente alla transizione climatica.


Supportiamo istituzioni e aziende nella progettazione di politiche di investimento, nell'integrazione di capitali pubblici e privati e nella conduzione di analisi d'impatto complete per valutare gli effetti economici, sociali e ambientali. La nostra esperienza garantisce strategie di sviluppo robuste e inclusive per un futuro sostenibile.


La figura che stiamo ricercando √® un/una Data Scientist con un‚Äôesperienza di 1-3 anni.


Descrizione del Profilo:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una Data Scientist con un‚Äôesperienza di 1-3 anni, pronto a contribuire allo sviluppo e all‚Äôottimizzazione di modelli di Machine Learning per applicazioni aziendali, in ambito economico e analisi del rischio. La persona selezionata si occuper√† dell‚Äôanalisi e pulizia dei dati, garantendo qualit√† e integrit√† nei processi analitici, e collaborer√† con team di esperti di dati e stakeholder aziendali per definire metriche e KPI rilevanti.

Il ruolo prevede anche la sperimentazione e il tuning di algoritmi per migliorare le performance predittive o generative, oltre alla creazione di report e documentazione per la condivisione dei risultati con i team di business.



Responsabilit√† principali:

  • Sviluppo e ottimizzazione di modelli di Machine Learning per applicazioni e analisi aziendali;
  • Analisi e pulizia dei dati per garantire qualit√† e integrit√† nei processi analitici;
  • Collaborazione con team di Data Expert e Business stakeholders per la definizione di metriche e KPI;
  • Sperimentazione e tuning di algoritmi per migliorare le performance predittive;
  • Creazione di report e documentazione per la comunicazione dei risultati ai team di business.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea magistrale in matematica, statistica, fisica, computer science o ingegneria informatica, preferibilmente ambito STEM;
  • Fino a 1-3 anni di esperienza nel ruolo di Data Scientist;
  • Conoscenza approfondita di Python e librerie per Machine Learning (ad es. scikit-learn, statsmodel, PyTorch);
  • Conoscenza di SQL per l‚Äôestrazione e manipolazione dei dati;
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôanalisi esplorativa e nella preparazione dei dati;
  • Familiarit√† con tecniche di valutazione e interpretazione dei modelli di ML;
  • Conoscenza di base degli strumenti cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP);
  • Conoscenza base di MLOps e deployment di modelli in produzione;
  • Capacit√† di lavorare con dataset di grandi dimensioni e tecniche di Feature Engineering.


Completano il profilo:

  • Esperienza con Databricks o framework come PySpark e MLflow;
  • Esperienza in progetti in ambito Economics o Climate Science;
  • Il possesso di un portfolio di progetti in ambito Data Science √® considerato un plus.


Cosa offriamo:

  • Opportunit√† di crescita professionale in un settore in forte sviluppo;
  • Un team giovane e motivato;
  • Ambienti di lavoro moderni nelle citt√† di Roma, Cosenza e Milano;
  • Flessibilit√† lavorativa grazie al nostro accordo di smart working, che favorisce un‚Äôadeguata work life integration;
  • Retribuzione competitiva;
  • Ticket Restaurant e possibilit√† di altri benefit in base al livello di retribuzione,
  • Programmi di formazione per ampliare le proprie conoscenze;
  • Opportunit√† di carriera costruite su misura, basate su un criterio meritocratico e una formazione continua.

Sede di lavoro: Roma (Smart Working)

Diamo valore soprattutto all‚Äôambizione e alla motivazione.

Questa posizione lavorativa √® rivolta anche alle Categorie Protette in base alla legge 68/99.

OpenEconomics promuove l'uguaglianza di opportunit√†. Tutti i candidati qualificati riceveranno considerazione per l'impiego senza distinzione di etnia, religione, genere, identit√† o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, origine nazionale, et√†, disabilit√† o altro ai sensi della L. 903/77.

IT, funzioni di business, executives);

Title: AI Expert
Description:
A Joint Venture between Thales (67%) and Leonardo (33%), Thales Alenia Space is a global space manufacturer delivering, for more than 40 years, high-tech solutions for telecommunications, navigation, Earth Observation, environmental management, exploration, science and orbital infrastructures. Thanks to our diversity of skills, talents and cultures, our customers (governments, institutions, space agencies, telecommunications operators), therefore have Space to Connect, Secure & Defend, Observe & Protect, Explore, Travel & Navigate.

Artificial Intelligence Engineering

CANDIDATES THAT WOULD IMPRESS US

PROFILE:

You graduated from an Engineering School with a master‚Äôs degree ‚Äì a PhD is a plus

Your level of experience ranges from junior to advance: you are a student OR/AND you have already occupied one or more positions among the following: Algorithm or Software Engineer, Artificial Intelligence Engineer

You are curious and willing to stay abreast of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

You enjoy thinking "outside the box" and use your creativity to address complex challenges

You are recognised as a team player and promote collaborative work

You are user centric and want to design components accordingly

COMPETENCIES:

You have in-depth knowledge in mathematics, algorithms, experiment plan, continuous iterations and Agility

You are proficient in one of the following Artificial Intelligence Approches:

Data driven AI, Symbolic AI, Hybrid AI on the Solution

Symbolic Artificial Intelligence and reasoning

Human/machine dialog

Systems Analysis

You understand the norms, laws and standards

You have knowledge of cybersecurity

You can confidently discuss with people from different jobs and background

You master foundational concepts in mathematics/ statistics science and their application to deploy them on Solution studies: statistical modelling, linear algebra, optimisation, machine learning Mathematics and Statistics

LIFE AS A THALES ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ENGINEERING ROLE

As an Artificial Intelligence Engineering Role within Thales, you will:

Design and develop trustworthy artificial intelligence components for various domains

Identify the right cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence technologies (machine learning, symbolic AI, dialogue) and develop the Artificial Intelligence component accordingly

Work on Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Understanding (NLU), and also to design multimodal approaches for Human-Machin Dialog including intention understanding, reasoning and hybrid AI

Work on Machine Learning, causality vs. correlation, and/or other Data driven AI technics such as Random Forest, Evolutionary Algorithms, ‚Ä¶

Work on Symbolic AI, Ontology, Semantic Web, Knowledge based Reasoning, Meta-heuristics, Problem Solving, Operations Research, Decision Making and reasoning

Propose and design approach alternatives

Integrate scientific method into engineering system methodology

Ensure data knowledge and traceability

Define the system capabilities thanks to a functional, logical and value analysis, describing functions to be performed to meet the real needs of the user in the various scenarii and maximising product value for Customer

YOUR CAREER AT THALES

Future opportunities will allow you to discover other domains or sites. You will be able to evolve and grow your competences in different areas:

Room and attention to personal development

Build your talents in another domain of Thales Group, discovering new products, new customers, new country or go to a more complex Solution

Choose between a technical expertise or a leadership path

Build an international career within a leading Engineering Group

At Thales Alenia Space we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales Alenia Space employing around 8,900 employees in 10 countries with 17 sites in Europe and a plant in the US, our mobility policy enables employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad. Thales Alenia Space sees space as a new horizon, helping to build a better, more sustainable life on Earth #SpaceForLife. Great journeys start here, apply now!
